words: So what does he care if you put lifts in?

speaker: MICKEY
words: You don't understand. There's an unwritten code about this kind of thing. I could be ostracized. I remember when I was a kid, some guy tried to heighten. He lost his job, lost his friends, Everything. Oh, I knew I was crazy to try this kind of thing, but I was so desperate. (pauses laying on the couch; jumps up) What is this kid taking anyway? Hormones? Steroids? Would you tell me!?

speaker: DAPHNE
words: George, tomorrow's Sunday. We could sleep late, and get the paper and half breakfast and spend the morning together, go for a long walk, maybe do a little shopping, have lunch...

speaker: GEORGE
words: (interrupts her) You know what. I don't think I'm going to be able to stay over tonight.

speaker: DAPHNE
words: Why not?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I, I really should go home. Ya.. actually I'm planning on spending the day with my father tomorrow (short laugh) we're uh we're going to a father-son picnic, just the two of us.

speaker: DAPHNE
words: I thought we were going to spend the day together.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well Dad's been planning this for such a long time, he bought a new blanket, and he got tha...that game with foam paddles and the Velcro ball. (laughs)

speaker: DAPHNE
words: Have you given any more thought to what we talked about? You know, moving in?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes, oh yes very much.

speaker: DAPHNE
words: Maybe you don't want to move in.

speaker: GEORGE
words: No, no I do. You know it's just...

speaker: DAPHNE
words: (interrupting him) Maybe Al Netchie was right, maybe I shouldn't have gotten involved with you.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (angry that she believes Al was right) No he's not right. Al Netchie is not right! all right I'm canceling the father-son picnic. I don't know what he's gonna do with all that potato salad.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Phil cracking up) So then Pachyderm picks up the pieces of pizza, and mind you know they are burning hot.. he can barely hold 'em. I mean he's like trying to juggle (does a juggling motion and begins laughing) the pizza, you know ah. And then they go flying out of...

speaker: PHIL
words: (dying of laughter) I'm peeing in my pants.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (cont.) they go flying out of his hands, and one lands on her face and the other lands on his face. (pause as they both continue to laugh really hard) and the whole place went crazy.

speaker: PHIL
words: Oh, I'm sorry, Oh. What a story.

speaker: ELAINE
words: I know, I know, I was unbelievable

speaker: PHIL
words: Oh that is one of the funniest stories I've ever heard.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (wipes her eyes because she laughed so hard she cried) I know.

speaker: PHIL
words: Well this has been one hell of a night.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, I'm sorry Jerry didn't suggest this sooner.

speaker: PHIL
words: You know, you really are beautiful Elaine.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, well, (pauses) Good night.

speaker: PHIL
words: Good night?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well (leans in to kiss Phil, then looks down at his pants with a awkward look on her face)

speaker: JERRY
words: (on phone) Come on Adrian give me another chance, I know I could cheer Fulton up. I'll tell you what, I'll do my act (pauses for response from Adrian) No new material (Elaine enters) He's never heard it. He'll love it, I just did it at the Concord last week. It killed. (waves hello to Elaine; pauses for response from Adrian) Thank you, thanks fo.. you will not regret this. Ok, Bye. (hangs up phone; to Elaine) Hey.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Hello.

speaker: JERRY
words: So?

speaker: ELAINE
words: What?

speaker: JERRY
words: Come on. How was your date?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, the date. The date.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya how was it?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Interesting.

speaker: JERRY
words: Really.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh ya.

speaker: JERRY
words: Why what happened?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Let's see, (thinking) how shall I put this.

speaker: JERRY
words: Just put it.

speaker: ELAINE
words: He took it out.

speaker: JERRY
words: (confused) He what?

speaker: ELAINE
words: He took (blows on her glasses twice to clean them) it out.

speaker: JERRY
words: He took what out?

speaker: ELAINE
words: It.

speaker: JERRY
words: He took It, Out?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yessiree Bob.

speaker: JERRY
words: He couldn't.

speaker: ELAINE
words: He did.

speaker: JERRY
words: (motions of making out) Well you were involved in some sort of amorous...

speaker: ELAINE
words: Noooo.

speaker: JERRY
words: You mean he just

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yes.

speaker: JERRY
words: Are you sure?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh quite.

speaker: JERRY
words: There was no mistaking it?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (looks straight into his eyes) Jerry.

speaker: JERRY
words: So you were talking, (Elaine makes an agreement sound "mmm") you're having pleasant conversation, (Elaine makes an agreement sound "mmm") then all of sudden...

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yea.

speaker: JERRY
words: It.

speaker: ELAINE
words: It.

speaker: JERRY
words: Out.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Out.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well I, I can't believe this. I know Phil, he, he's a good friend of mine. We play softball together. How could this be?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh it be. (sarcastically) You got any other friends you want to set me up with?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey. (to Elaine) Hey how was your date with Phil Titola?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (to Kramer) He took it out.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Maybe uh, it needed some air. You know sometimes they need air, they can't breathe in there. It's in human.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So she's just sitting there, she's having a pleasant conversation... and all of a sudden.

speaker: JERRY
words: It.

speaker: GEORGE
words: It.

speaker: JERRY
words: Out.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Out. (Jerry shakes his head in agreement) Wow. I spend so much time trying to get their clothes off, I never thought of taking mine off. (Jerry nods; George looks at his watch) all right, Hey come on, get out of here, Daphne gonna be here any minute.

speaker: JERRY
words: All right I'm going.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You know what I've come to realize? I'm not just bored. I genuinely dislike her.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well how long you are going to keep this up?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey I'll get married if I have to. Al Netchie will think twice before he opens his mouth about me again.

speaker: JERRY
words: You know George they are doing wonderful things at mental institutions these days. I'd be happy to set-up a meet and greet.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm very disappointed to here you talk like that. You still don't know what makes me tick.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes I do.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What are you doing?

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm going to the hospital to see Fulton. I'm not even saying hello, I'm going right into material.

speaker: PHIL
words: Ah hey Jer.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh hey Phil.

speaker: PHIL
words: You know I'm sorry things didn't work out with Elaine. I don't know what I did wrong.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, y..you showed her who you are.

speaker: PHIL
words: Oh, look at this, what she's got to breast feed in public.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya, that's the.. last thing you want to see. Well, next to last.

speaker: PHIL
words: I'll see ya.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya take it easy.

speaker: JERRY
words: (acting like he was walking on stage) Hey how ya doing? Good to be here.

speaker: MICKEY
words: all right, rock beats paper.

speaker: KRAMER
words: I thought paper covered rock?

speaker: MICKEY
words: Nah, rock flies right through paper.

speaker: KRAMER
words: What beats rock?

speaker: MICKEY
words: (looks at his hand) Nothing beats rock.

speaker: KRAMER
words: all right come on.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Rock.

speaker: MICKEY
words: Rock

speaker: KRAMER
words: Rock.

speaker: MICKEY
words: Rock.

speaker: MICKEY
words: Hey Bob. What's with you? You gotta problem? (to Kramer) You see that look he gave me? (starts to get up to go after him)

speaker: KRAMER
words: (stops Mickey) all right, come on.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Rock.

speaker: MICKEY
words: Rock.

speaker: MICKEY
words: Hey Tammy.

speaker: TAMMY
words: Hello.

speaker: MICKEY
words: So Tammy, finally, today's our big lunch.

speaker: TAMMY
words: I don't think so.

speaker: MICKEY
words: Why not? What the hell are you talking about?

speaker: TAMMY
words: Look Mickey, everybody knows that you're heightening. It's all over the set.

speaker: MICKEY
words: Wait, wait (goes to grab her arm)

speaker: TAMMY
words: (recoils) Don't touch me. You ought to be ashamed of yourself. All the progress we made over the years and you go and blow it by pulling a stupid stunt like this.

speaker: MICKEY
words: Wait a second, wait a second, you got me all wrong. It was all because of the kid. (numerous little people begin to crowd around them) (to Tammy) The kid was growing. He shot up two and a half inches in a month. (to all the little people) I woulda' lost my job. Any one of you would have done the same. You got no right! I'm Mickey Abbott! I stood in for Punky Brewster when all of you was nothing. (seeing the crowd still doesn't agree with what he did, he points at Kramer) It's all his fault. (Kramer acts like he doesn't know what Mickey is talking about) It was his idea.

speaker: TAMMY
words: Come on Johnny, let's go get something to eat.

speaker: MICKEY
words: (in complete disgust as seeing Tammy leave with Johnny) AH! (turns and looks at Kramer) AH!

speaker: KRAMER
words: What?

speaker: MICKEY
words: AH!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Mickey!

speaker: JERRY
words: This guy's belching out vitamins..

speaker: FULTON
words: (dying of laughter and coughing) Stop.

speaker: JERRY
words: (cont.) and this whole justice league, Batman, Green Lantern, Wonder Woman. You mean to tell me Superman can't cover everything?

speaker: FULTON
words: (still laughing and coughing) Stop.

speaker: JERRY
words: For crying out loud, He's Superman. (Fulton stops laughing, Jerry's face is stunned) Fulton? (looks at him) Fulton?

speaker: DAPHNE
words: George, first let me just say I've never been with a guy who was so committed to commit. I mean it's so rare in men these days an, that's what makes this all the more difficult.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (happily) Difficult?

speaker: DAPHNE
words: The other day, after work, some girlfriends and I went to a bar for some drinks and there was this crazy mishap and I wound up meeting someone as a result. George...

speaker: GEORGE
words: (acting disappointed) Oh, please don't.

speaker: DAPHNE
words: Uh, I'm sorry. I'm afraid the worst of it is it's someone you know. Jerry Persheck.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Pachyderm?

speaker: DAPHNE
words: Heh, he was carrying these two pieces of pizza...

speaker: THE END
words: THE END

speaker: MERYL
words: Good morning.

speaker: JERRY
words: Good morning.

speaker: MERYL
words: How'd you sleep?

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, you are the couch tonight, young lady. You were all over my side.

speaker: MERYL
words: I was not!

speaker: JERRY
words: C'mon, I was sleeping with one cheek off the bed!

speaker: MERYL
words: By the way, you're falling way behind on the 'I love you's.'

speaker: MERYL
words: No, it's 15-8.

speaker: JERRY
words: I know I can't beat ya, I'm just trying to stay competitive.

speaker: MERYL
words: Alright c'mon, let's get some breakfast.

speaker: JERRY
words: Uh, let me get a coat. I think I'll try a sport jacket and scarf thing, you know, like an unemployed actor. (Goes into his room, and comes back out with the jacket on.) Haven't worn this one in a long time.

speaker: MERYL
words: Ooh, cashmere?

speaker: JERRY
words: No, gore-tex. It's new. (Checks his pockets.) Hey, look at this locket. What the hell is this? There's a picture in here, look at that.

speaker: MERYL
words: Wow, this is really old. You don't know whose it is?

speaker: JERRY
words: No, I haven't worn this jacket since I got it back from the dry-cleaner. Maybe we should ask him.

speaker: MERYL
words: Alright, we'll stop over there.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah. What do you want to get for breakfast?

speaker: MERYL
words: Pancakes.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh now, c'mon, you know I'm getting pancakes.

speaker: MERYL
words: I don't know that!  Mark's Michelle is a dog.

speaker: JERRY
words: But we can't both get pancakes, it's embarrassing. It's like one step from the couples who dress alike.

speaker: MERYL
words: I'll get the short stack.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ah, that's why I love ya. 15-9. (They go out into the hallway and run into Kramer and his African-American girlfriend, Anna.) Hey, how ya doin.'

speaker: KRAMER
words: We just got back from breakfast. The pancakes were dynamite.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, is that my maple syrup? (Kramer hands it over.)

speaker: MERYL
words: You bring your own syrup?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Got to.

speaker: JERRY
words: You got a lot to learn about pancakes.

speaker: MARTY
words: This is my wife. She died eight years ago. I been looking all over for this!

speaker: JERRY
words: Boy, it's a lucky thing I put the jacket on. But how did it get in the pocket?

speaker: MARTY
words: Well, see here, the chain is broken...it must have slipped in when I was, uh...(gestures at the racks of clothes behind him.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, wow.

speaker: MARTY
words: I turned my house upside-down looking for this! It's all I have left of her.

speaker: MERYL
words: Oh, that's so touching.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, come on!

speaker: MARTY
words: What are you talkin' about?

speaker: JERRY
words: It's silly!

speaker: MARTY
words: Hey, forget it!

speaker: JERRY
words: Get outta here!

speaker: MARTY
words: It's done!

speaker: JERRY
words: Alright.

speaker: MERYL
words: Well, I guess I get it too, because I'm his wife.

speaker: MARTY
words: I didn't know you were married.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh...yeah...you've never met my wife, Meryl? Meryl Seinfeld.

speaker: MARTY
words: Sure, you get the discount, too.

speaker: JERRY
words: You might regret that, because the money my wife spends on clothes...

speaker: MERYL
words: I'm taking him to the cleaners!

speaker: JERRY
words: Ah - see the sense of humor? C'mere, I'm so nuts about you...(hugs Meryl.) I tell ya, it was fun being single, but when you meet a woman like this, you don't walk to get married - you run!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, hi Greg.

speaker: GREG
words: Haven't seen you in a while.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah. Well, today was the first day I worked out since the Central Park Mini-Marathon.

speaker: GREG
words: You ran the Mini-Marathon?

speaker: ELAINE
words: No, but I exercised that day. (Laughs.)

speaker: GREG
words: Well, I gotta take off.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, I guess as an airline pilot, you're one of the few people who can say that and mean it. (Laughs again. Greg looks at her, unamused.) Um, do you have the time?

speaker: GREG
words: Eleven-thirty.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Eleven-thirty?

speaker: GREG
words: Wait, ten-thirty. Sorry.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh.

speaker: GREG
words: Do you have to be somewhere?

speaker: ELAINE
words: No.

speaker: GREG
words: Then what are you doing?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I'm just waiting for my friend George, we worked out together.

speaker: GREG
words: Oh. Well, it was good seeing you.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, nice to see you, too.

speaker: MERYL
words: Uh, would you, um...can I...

speaker: JERRY
words: Pardon?

speaker: MERYL
words: The syrup. Would you pass the syrup?

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, you want to try the syrup! (Meryl smiles and takes it. The waitress comes over.)

speaker: WAITRESS
words: Can I get you anything else?

speaker: JERRY
words: Um, yeah...I think my wife and I'll have a little more coffee.

speaker: WAITRESS
words: Okay.

speaker: MERYL
words: And a check for my husband.

speaker: JERRY
words: To my beautiful wife.

speaker: MERYL
words: To my adoring husband.

speaker: JERRY
words: Adoring? What about handsome?

speaker: MERYL
words: I like adoring.

speaker: JERRY
words: Sure, adoring's good for you, what does it do for me? (Meryl laughs. The owner of the coffee shop comes over.)

speaker: OWNER
words: Excuse me...where did you get that?

speaker: JERRY
words: I, uh...well...

speaker: OWNER
words: Uh, we don't allow any outside syrups, jams or condiments in the restaurant. (To Jerry) And if I catch you in here with that again...I will confiscate it.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, I told my wife not to bring it.

speaker: JERRY
words: No, just Meryl.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Why, why? Why does she get it?

speaker: JERRY
words: Because she's my wife! (The door buzzer sounds, and Jerry lets Elaine into the building - Jerry: Yeh? Elaine: Meh. Jerry: Eh.) And I'll tell ya, I'm really enjoying this marriage thing. You think about each other. You care about each other. It's wonderful! Plus, I love saying "my wife." Once I started saying it, I couldn't stop - "my wife" this, "my wife" that...it's an amazing way to begin a sentence.

speaker: KRAMER
words: "My wife has an inner ear infection."

speaker: JERRY
words: See?

speaker: KRAMER
words: I like that! Hey look, will you do me a favor? Will you take my quilt into the cleaners for me, so I can get the discount too?

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh come on, we're gonna start doing this now? I can't be taking all your dry-cleaning in!

speaker: KRAMER
words: C'mon, just this one time! It's expensive!

speaker: JERRY
words: Alright. (Elaine enters.)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey. Hey Elaine, what do you say if neither of us is married in ten years, we get hitched?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Let's make it fifty.

speaker: KRAMER
words: We're engaged! Alright, I'm gonna get my quilt. (Kramer leaves.)

speaker: ELAINE
words: Alright, listen to this. Remember that guy I was telling you about at the health club?

speaker: JERRY
words: The fly-boy.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, where's George? I thought he was with you.

speaker: ELAINE
words: I waited, he didn't show up. Anyway, this guy gave me an open-lip kiss.

speaker: JERRY
words: So?

speaker: ELAINE
words: So? We've always just kind've pecked. This one had a totally different dynamic.

speaker: JERRY
words: Really.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah. I mean, his upper lip landed flush on my upper lip. But his lower lip landed well below my rim.

speaker: JERRY
words: Moisture?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah. Definite moisture.

speaker: JERRY
words: That's an open-lip kiss, alright.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah. Listen, I think he's giving me a big signal...maybe he wants to change our relationship. (The buzzer sounds, Elaine answers it.) Yeah?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh, uh...it's George.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Hey, what happened to you?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Nothing...little problem.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well, what was it? I mean, I was waiting.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Can I come upstairs, please? (Elaine pushes the button and lets George in.)

speaker: ELAINE
words: I mean, maybe he wants to ask me out.

speaker: JERRY
words: I don't know why you're interested in this guy, he's a jerk.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Because, he doesn't pay any attention to me, and he ignores me.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, so?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I respect that. (George enters.) Mmm, what happened?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Nothing, I... said it was a little problem.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah? What was it?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well...I was in the locker room showering, and I...I had to go, so...

speaker: JERRY
words: Here we go.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Anyway, I think the guy in the shower opposite saw me. He gave me a dirty look.

speaker: ELAINE
words: You went...in the shower?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yeah, so what? I'm not the only one! (Kramer enters with his quilt.)

speaker: ELAINE
words: Do you go in the shower?

speaker: JERRY
words: No, never.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Do you?

speaker: KRAMER
words: I take baths.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, what was I supposed to do? Get out of the shower, put on my bathrobe? Go all the way down to the other end? Come all the way back?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Ever hear of...holding it in?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh, no...no, that's very bad for the kidneys.

speaker: ELAINE
words: How do you know?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Medical journals!

speaker: JERRY
words: Do the medical journals mention anything about standing in a pool of someone else's urine?

speaker: JERRY
words: Hello.

speaker: MERYL
words: Oh, hi...honey.

speaker: JERRY
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: MERYL
words: I just thought I'd drop off a few things.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh. (Smiles at Marty nervously.) Well, I must have been in the incinerator room when you left. Here you go, Marty. (Hands over Kramer's quilt.)

speaker: MARTY
words: Another quilt? Huh? (Uncle Leo enters.)

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: Jerry!

speaker: JERRY
words: Uncle Leo!

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: Hello!

speaker: JERRY
words: Hello.

speaker: MARTY
words: So, if you or your wife want to drop by on Wednesday, it should be ready.

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: Your wife?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah...my wife.

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: JERRY
words: Uh...I got married.

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: You got married? I wasn't invited? Nobody sends me an invitation?

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, it was sudden.

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: Are you ashamed of your uncle? Do I embarrass you?

speaker: JERRY
words: No, no, it was a small ceremony.

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: Haven't I always been a good uncle?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes, yes, you have.

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: Who told you when you went to school that you print well?

speaker: JERRY
words: You did, you did.

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: When he was younger, he had a beautiful penmanship. I used to encourage him to print.

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm a good printer.

speaker: UNCLE LEO
words: I remember your 'V.' It was like a perfect triangle. Whoa, there's my bus! (Rushes out.) Hello! Wait! (Jerry tries to catch Leo before he runs off to tell him about his "pretend marriage," but doesn't make it.)

speaker: GREG
words: I'm glad you're here. This can get really boring. Do you know where I can get some good olives?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I can find out.

speaker: GREG
words: Would ya?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Sure. (Thinks - Ooh, a project. That's a definite signal!)

speaker: GREG
words: By the way, you look really great in that leotard.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, thanks. (Thinks - That's no signal, who wouldn't like me in this leotard? I look amazing in this leotard.)

speaker: GREG
words: Hey, you know what's weird? I think I had a dream about you last night.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Thinks - Okay, he open-lips me, he dreams about me, we have an olive project...that's it, I'm asking this guy out.) Um, you know Greg, I...

speaker: GREG
words: Can I have a sip of your water?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, yeah, sure. (Hands Greg her bottle.)

speaker: GREG
words: Thanks. (Is about to take a drink, but wipes the neck of the bottle with his shirt first.)

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Thinks - Oh my God.)

speaker: GREG
words: I'm sorry, what were you saying?

speaker: ELAINE
words: It was nothing, forget it. (George enters the gym.)

speaker: GREG
words: See that guy right there? I caught him urinating in the shower. I'm thinking about turning him in, too. (On the other side of the room, George falls off an exercise machine and gets his foot caught in it.)

speaker: MERYL
words: Honey? Could you get me something to drink?

speaker: JERRY
words: You're right there.

speaker: MERYL
words: C'mon, I'm sitting! (Jerry walks to the kitchen, annoyed. Meryl laughs at the TV show she's watching.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Honey, what'd you do with the can opener?

speaker: MERYL
words: I didn't do anything with it.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, it's not here, it was here yesterday.

speaker: MERYL
words: It's in the first drawer.

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm looking in the first drawer. It's not here.

speaker: MERYL
words: Yes, it is.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey...I'm not stupid. I'm looking in that drawer, there's no can opener.

speaker: MERYL
words: Did I say you were stupid?

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, wouldn't I have to be? You tell me there's a can opener in the drawer, I'm looking in the drawer, there's no can opener - what other conclusion could one reach? (The phone rings.)

speaker: MERYL
words: Do you want me to go find it?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes. I do. You show me where there's a can opener in that drawer. (Answers the phone.) Hello! I'm sorry, I'm just fighting with my wife.

speaker: HELEN
words: Jerry, we just heard, what's going on?

speaker: MORTY
words: Why the hell didn't you tell us?

speaker: JERRY
words: Listen, Ma...

speaker: MERYL
words: It was in here yesterday!

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, that's what I said!

speaker: HELEN
words: Who is she? When did this happen?

speaker: MORTY
words: I told her you'd get married. She thought you'd never do it.

speaker: HELEN
words: Morty, you're talking too loud.

speaker: MORTY
words: I'm not talking loud!

speaker: HELEN
words: You're hurting my eardrum.

speaker: MERYL
words: Well, you must have done something with it!

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm on the phone!

speaker: HELEN
words: Is she there? Can we talk to her? What's her name?

speaker: JERRY
words: Mom, I'm not married.

speaker: HELEN
words: What?

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm not married!

speaker: MORTY
words: I knew it, I told ya!

speaker: HELEN
words: Uncle Leo said.

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm just pretending I'm married to get a discount on dry-cleaning.

speaker: HELEN
words: A discount on dry-cleaning?

speaker: JERRY
words: Could you make a little more noise? (To his parents) Listen, I'm gonna have to call you later.

speaker: MERYL
words: Well, I give up.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, whoopie whoop. (Meryl goes into the other room. Kramer staggers in the door in his bathrobe.)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Got any coffee?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah. (Kramer lurches into the kitchen, trips, and falls onto the kitchen floor.) I'll get it, I'll get it! Take it easy, why are you so tired?

speaker: KRAMER
words: My quilt is still at the cleaners. Jerry, I can't sleep without my quilt. Like the other night? I was cold. So, last night, I turn up the heat - it's too hot. I open up a window - it's too cold. (Frantic) I can't get into a zone!

speaker: JERRY
words: What is that? (Points to Kramer's pocket as Meryl comes back.)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, I forgot. (Hands back Jerry's can opener.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, I'm sorry about all that can opener stuff.

speaker: MERYL
words: Yeah, me too. Love you.

speaker: JERRY
words: Love you.

speaker: MERYL
words: Well, goodnight.

speaker: JERRY
words: Goodnight. (They kiss goodnight, then promptly roll away from each other and go to sleep.)

speaker: GEORGE
words: They could kick me out of the health club if he tells them!

speaker: ELAINE
words: So what do you want me to do?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Talk to him!

speaker: ELAINE
words: How can I do that?

speaker: GEORGE
words: You said the guy gave you an open-lipped kiss!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yes, but then he wiped his hand on the top of the bottle when I offered him water!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, that doesn't mean anything!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Are you kidding? That's very significant! If he was interested in me, he'd want my germs! He'd just crave my germs!

speaker: JERRY
words: She's right, George. Bottle-wipe is big.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, what about the open-lipped kiss?

speaker: JERRY
words: Bottle-wipe supercedes it.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yeah, you're right, you're right. (To Elaine) Alright, maybe he's not interested, but you still know him - can't you just ask him?

speaker: ELAINE
words: George...but if I ask him now, I will have no chance of going out with him.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Why?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I...I don't know...

speaker: GEORGE
words: Aha. Aha. Could it be because you don't want him to know that you have a friend who pees in the shower, is that it?!

speaker: ELAINE
words: No, that's not it!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh, I think it is! I think that's exactly what it is!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Why couldn't you just wait?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I was there! I saw a drain!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Since when is a drain a toilet?!

speaker: GEORGE
words: It's all pipes! What's the difference?!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Different pipes go to different places! You're gonna mix 'em up!

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'll call a plumber right now! (Goes for the phone.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Alright, can we just drop all the pee-pipe stuff here?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Okay! Okay! I will talk to him. (Kramer enters.)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Jerry, I think that quilt is ready.

speaker: JERRY
words: Alright.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, you gotta pick it up for me!

speaker: JERRY
words: Alright, I'll pick it up, but it's the last time I'm doin' it!

speaker: KRAMER
words: I'm so tired!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Boy, you don't look good.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Huh? I don't?

speaker: ELAINE
words: No, you look pale.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Pale? Oh my God...I gotta meet Anna's parents today! (The phone rings.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Hello? Oh, hi honey. (annoyed, weary) Yes, I told him. I'll get it. (George and Elaine give each other a look, then leave Jerry to argue with Meryl on the phone.) Whenever. Okay, I'm sorry...

speaker: MARTY
words: I'm sorry, it's not ready yet. (Kramer bursts in.)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Not ready? It has to be ready! What kind of a business are you running here?

speaker: MARTY
words: Who the hell are you? It's not your quilt.

speaker: JERRY
words: He's a very good friend of mine, he's kind've like an older brother to me...when things don't go right, he kinda takes it personally.

speaker: MARTY
words: Well, uh...maybe tomorrow.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Maybe.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, it's okay, it'll be okay.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Alright, I'm gonna see you later.

speaker: JERRY
words: Where you goin'?

speaker: KRAMER
words: I gotta meet Anna's parents today, remember? I look terrible! I'm gonna hit the tanning machines.

speaker: JERRY
words: I can't believe you still do that. You know those things are bad for ya.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, that's how I maintain my glow.

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm goin' home. (Kramer exits. An attractive woman enters the dry-cleaners with a bundle of clothes in her hands. Jerry notices her and waits by the door.)

speaker: PAULA
words: Excuse me? Uh, how much would it cost to clean this?

speaker: MARTY
words: Oh, about thirteen dollars.

speaker: PAULA
words: Thirteen? Well, I can't afford that.

speaker: MARTY
words: Well, I'm sorry.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Hi, Greg.

speaker: GREG
words: Hey, Elaine. I'll be off in a second. (Another guy approaches the exercise machine.)

speaker: ELAINE
words: I got the machine next, buddy. (Greg finishes up his workout and gets off the machine.)

speaker: GREG
words: It's all yours. (Walks away. Elaine looks at the machine, then George runs over.)

speaker: GEORGE
words: What happened? Did he bring it up?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Never mind that, look at the signal I just got.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Signal? What signal?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Lookit. He knew I was gonna use the machine next, he didn't wipe his sweat off. That's a gesture of intimacy.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'll tell you what that is - that's a violation of club rules. Now I got him! And you're my witness!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Listen, George! Listen! He knew what he was doing, this was a signal.

speaker: GEORGE
words: A guy leaves a puddle of sweat, that's a signal?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah! It's a social thing.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What if he left you a used Kleenex, what's that, a valentine? Now you go up to him and you tell him that if he's thinking of turning me in, that I got the goods on him!

speaker: ELAINE
words: No! I won't be a party to this.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So you're gonna let me get suspended for shower urination?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Okay, I'll talk to him. But you're putting me in a very difficult position. (Walks away.)

speaker: PAULA
words: I won't let you do this!

speaker: JERRY
words: I want to!

speaker: PAULA
words: But it isn't right! I can't.

speaker: JERRY
words: Give me the clothes.

speaker: PAULA
words: Jerry, please. What about her?

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, the hell with her. (Paula dramatically flees from the coffee shop. Jerry thinks for a second, then follows her and catches up to her on the street.)

speaker: PAULA
words: No, Jerry, please!

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm not gonna let you walk out of my life.

speaker: PAULA
words: I can't fight you. (They embrace and kiss passionately.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Do you want box or hanger?

speaker: PAULA
words: You decide. (Jerry considers.)

speaker: ELAINE
words: You're really working up quite a sweat today, huh?

speaker: GREG
words: Yeah. (Spies the shapely manager of the health club.) Oh, there's the manager. Good. I think I'm gonna talk to her about that guy, you know, we cannot have people like that in here.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Are you sure you want to do that?

speaker: GREG
words: Yeah. He's disgusting! Besides, I'll take any chance I can to talk to her.

speaker: ELAINE
words: You're interested in...in her? (Points at the manager.)

speaker: GREG
words: Very.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Ah. You know, uh...I'm engaged. (preens) Yep, gettin' married in fifty years. (Snaps the straps of her leotard against her chest and winces. George walks by the manager.)

speaker: GREG
words: Oh good, there he is. I wanna be able to point him out.

speaker: ELAINE
words: You know, Greg, I wouldn't do that if I were you.

speaker: GREG
words: Why?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well, correct me if I'm wrong, but isn't it a violation of club policy to not wipe down a machine after using it?

speaker: GREG
words: Oh, I see...you're friends with the urinator, aren't you?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, well, at least he had a drain.

speaker: MERYL
words: Here you go. (Pays Marty, then looks at the clothes on the hanger.) Excuse me, this isn't mine.

speaker: MARTY
words: Oh, yes it is. Your husband brought it in himself.

speaker: MERYL
words: Really? (Takes her change and grabs the clothes off the hanger.) Thank you. (Exits.)

speaker: ANNA
words: That's him! (Opens the door. Kramer stands there, deeply tanned and smiling. Anna and her grandfather are shocked.)

speaker: MERYL
words: You son of a bitch!

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: MERYL
words: Who is she? I want to know who she is.

speaker: JERRY
words: It doesn't matter. I want a divorce.

speaker: MERYL
words: A divorce? Oh, so you can marry her and give her the discount?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes, that's right.

speaker: MERYL
words: What happened to us, Jerry?

speaker: JERRY
words: I'll tell you what happened. We got married.

speaker: MERYL
words: I'm sorry, this is my fault. I pushed it on you.

speaker: JERRY
words: No. I guess I just wasn't ready for the responsibilities of a pretend marriage.

speaker: MERYL
words: Goodbye, Jerry. Oh, I forgot...(reaches in her purse)...this is your maple syrup.

speaker: JERRY
words: It's alright, I want you to have it.

speaker: MERYL
words: Okay, thanks.

speaker: JERRY
words: We'll always have...pancakes.

speaker: MERYL
words: Bye, Jerry. (Exits.)

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I thought you said you was bringin' a white boy home! I don't see a white boy! I see a damn fool!

speaker: THE END
words: THE END

speaker: JERRY
words: I really feel as human beings, we need more training in our basic social skills. Conversational Distance, don't you hate these people that talk to you they talk into your mouth like you're a clown at a drive-through and Hand shakes is the worst, there's absolutely no guidelines for hand shakes you know these people? Too long, too weak, sometimes they give you the three-quarter handshake just the fingers, early release, late release, sometimes people will dispute your release, you let go there're hangin' on. I have actually said to people 'Hey the handshake is over!.' Too many pumps, coming in too high, too sweaty, coming from too far away. Sometimes a guy will give you a strong grip, late release, and pull you in for the too close conversation. To him I say 'That's three strikes you're out.'

speaker: JERRY
words: You know their timing couldn't be worse.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Is there ever a good time to have your parents stay with you?

speaker: JERRY
words: You don't understand, I haven't been together with Rachel for like three weeks. First I was on the road, then my parents show up, I'm getting a little uh backed up.

speaker: GEORGE
words: When are they leaving for Paris?

speaker: JERRY
words: Not for another three days.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What about her place?

speaker: JERRY
words: She lives with her parents.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Really? (Jerry shakes his head) Maybe this will become like a cool thing, living with your parents.

speaker: JERRY
words: (sarcastically)Ya, then maybe baldness will catch on. This will all be turning your way.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey believe me, baldness will catch on. When the aliens come, who do you think they're gonna relate to? Who do you think is going to be the first ones getting a tour of the ship?

speaker: JERRY
words: The baldies

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey by the way my parents really want to have your parents over dinner before they leave town.

speaker: JERRY
words: That's good, then I get the apartment for at least one night. You know I'm paying for this whole Paris trip it's their anniversary present.

speaker: ALEC
words: (walking over to Jerry and George's table) Hey guys.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey Alec

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey Alec

speaker: ALEC
words: This is Joey.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey Joey, how you doin'?

speaker: ALEC
words: (Joey was about to talk) Hey listen, I was wondering if either one of you guys would be interested in doing some work for the Big Brother program? I'm kinda running the local chapter. What do you say George?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well uh....

speaker: JOEY
words: (interrupts) Wouldn't you like to be a big brother to someone like me? Please?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, sure Joey, sure, I would be thrilled.

speaker: ALEC
words: That's great George, thanks a lot I'll get in touch with you.

speaker: JOEY
words: Wouldn't you like to be a big brother..

speaker: ALEC
words: (grabs Joey to stop him) Ya alright Joey that's enough, let's go (walking over to the counter) See ya.

speaker: JERRY
words: What happened?

speaker: GEORGE
words: What could I do? Did you see the mug on that kid?

speaker: JERRY
words: (acting like Joey) Wouldn't you like to pass the ketchup to someone like me? Please?

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey did you notice they moved where they do the interview on Jeopardy now?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ya it used to be right in the middle of single Jeopardy and now they do it right after single Jeopardy.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya, it's much better isn't it?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh, n-no comparison.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, I gotta stop off at the bookstore to pick up my parents one of those French-English dictionaries.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (stops Jerry realizing something) Hey hey hey hey hey hey.

speaker: JERRY
words: What?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Your parents are going to Paris right?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yea?

speaker: GEORGE
words: So I tell Alec that I have to goto Paris for an undetermined amount of time. Then all I have to do is buy some post cards and have your parents mail them from Paris.

speaker: JERRY
words: What about little Joey?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Who?

speaker: JERRY
words: Ah, I think he's probably better off.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm trying to get out of this Big Brother program. So when you get to Paris (handing Morty the postcards) all you have to do is drop 'em in any mailbox.

speaker: MORTY
words: But there are no stamps on these.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well no not yet, you gotta buy french stamps (pauses) I-I'll reimburse you of course.

speaker: HELEN
words: Why are you doing this?

speaker: JERRY
words: He wants this guy to think he's in Paris.

speaker: HELEN
words: Why?

speaker: JERRY
words: Because George is a deeply disturbed individual.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh hey, Helen uh, Could I uh, use some more of your hand lotion?

speaker: HELEN
words: I told you it was good. (hands Kramer the lotion)

speaker: KRAMER
words: (putting on the lotion) Ya

speaker: HELEN
words: It's from the Sachs Fifth Avenue in Miami.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Mmm (smelling the lotion as he rubs it in) I'm gonna remember that if I'm ever in Florida.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya, or if you're ever on Fifth Avenue here in New York City, you could get some there.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ya

speaker: MORTY
words: Say those are some nice pants. I got a pair just like them at home.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well uh that doesn't surprise me, ya i bought these at Rudy's. It's a used clothing store. See when people like you die, the widows they bring in their wardrobes, they make a bundle.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Really? My father has a ton of old clothes just sitting up in the attic, y-you think they're worth something?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ya if they're vintage, and you're a widow.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What happens if the husband dies after the wife, who brings in the clothing in then?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well I suppose the children do.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (pondering) Yes I suppose they do.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (takes another smell of his hands) Alright I gotta a ten o'clock, I'll see everybody later.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (grabbing his jacket) Hey oo, I just remembered uh my parents really wanna have you guys over for dinner before you leave town. What about tonight?

speaker: HELEN
words: Tonight?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yea they're making Payaya.

speaker: HELEN
words: (looking at Morty) Uh oh I don't think we think we can make it tonight, (turns toward George) we have plans.

speaker: JERRY
words: (watching the whole conversation from his desk) What plans?

speaker: HELEN
words: (turns to Jerry) We have plans.

speaker: JERRY
words: Where'd you get plans?

speaker: HELEN
words: (annoyed) We have plans.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well um, what about tomorrow night?

speaker: HELEN
words: (turns back toward George) Maybe

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ok uh, I guess I'll tell them that.

speaker: MORTY
words: (to George as he is about to leave) Hey give 'em our best though.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (quietly) Ya.

speaker: JERRY
words: (walking over toward George and the door) I'll call you later.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ya.

speaker: JERRY
words: So what plans do you have?

speaker: MORTY
words: None

speaker: JERRY
words: So how come you're not going over there for dinner?

speaker: HELEN
words: Jerry we don't care much for the Costanzas'.

speaker: MORTY
words: We can't stand them.

speaker: JERRY
words: Really? Since when?

speaker: HELEN
words: Since always. We've never liked them.

speaker: JERRY
words: Why?

speaker: HELEN
words: Well they're so loud, they're always fighting it's uncomfortable, you never notice?

speaker: JERRY
words: No I notice but they're from your age group I didn't know you could detect abnormal behavior among your own kind.

speaker: MORTY
words: Well we do.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya?

speaker: ELAINE
words: It's us.

speaker: JERRY
words: U-oh come on up. (buzzes them up) It's Elaine you don't have a problem with her do you?

speaker: HELEN
words: We adore Elaine.

speaker: JERRY
words: She wants to say hi, she's with her new boyfriend.

speaker: HELEN
words: What's he like?

speaker: JERRY
words: He's nice, bit of a close talker.

speaker: HELEN
words: A what?

speaker: JERRY
words: You'll see. (pause) Boy, I had no idea you felt this way about the Costanzas'

speaker: HELEN
words: They're exhausting it's like being in an Asylum.

speaker: EVERYONE
words: Hi.

speaker: MORTY
words: Hello Elaine

speaker: ELAINE
words: This is Aaron.

speaker: HELEN
words: Hello Aaron

speaker: MORTY
words: Hello.

speaker: AARON
words: (getting up in Helen's face) So how long you folks in town?

speaker: HELEN
words: Oh, three more days, three more days then we're off to Paris.

speaker: AARON
words: Ah

speaker: MORTY
words: We're going with a select charter group.

speaker: AARON
words: I love France, (moving over to Morty's face) I was just there last year. In fact, you know I still have an envelope full of French Franks, I'll give 'em to ya.

speaker: HELEN
words: We can't take money.

speaker: AARON
words: Oh, no, it's a gift. (looking toward Elaine) from us.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, that is soo nice (very elaborate nice) Aaron. Isn't he nice? (to Helen) So listen has Jerry been showin' you a good time?

speaker: JERRY
words: No I haven't.

speaker: AARON
words: You know (to Morty) I have a friend who works at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. How would you like a behind the scenes tour?

speaker: HELEN
words: (grabbing Aaron) Really, you could do that?

speaker: AARON
words: (up in Helen's face) Easily

speaker: HELEN
words: I wouldn't be any trouble?

speaker: AARON
words: (gets closer) Of course not.

speaker: HELEN
words: When would we go?

speaker: AARON
words: How about right now?

speaker: MORTY
words: I'm ready

speaker: HELEN
words: Are you sure?

speaker: AARON
words: Yes.

speaker: HELEN
words: Ok, let me get my coat.

speaker: AARON
words: (walking over to Elaine and getting into her face) Elaine what do you say?

speaker: ELAINE
words: W-well I don't think so Aaron, uh, I have plans.

speaker: AARON
words: Oh. (getting into Jerry's face) How about you Jerry?

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm swamped.

speaker: AARON
words: You sure? You could examine the art work up close.

speaker: JERRY
words: Maybe I'll try and catch up with you.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (under her breath) Ya that'll happen)

speaker: AARON
words: (Moving toward the door) Alright. We're off.

speaker: MORTY
words: Ok, bye.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ok buh bye. Have a good time.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Bye.

speaker: AARON
words: See everybody later (Morty and Helen leave; Aaron closes the door blowing Elaine a kiss)

speaker: JERRY
words: Ok.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Why would he ask your parents to go to a museum?

speaker: JERRY
words: I don't know.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What is that?

speaker: JERRY
words: Maybe he was just trying to be nice.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Have you ever heard of anyone doing anything like this?

speaker: JERRY
words: Wait a second, he just did me a big favor.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What?

speaker: JERRY
words: (dialing) He got em out of the house.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What?

speaker: JERRY
words: Call Rachel.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh.

speaker: JERRY
words: (on the phone) ah no, I got the machine. Rachel! Are you there?! I got the place to myself for a few hours! Rachel! Where are you? Rachel! (hangs up the phone very disappointed)

speaker: ELAINE
words: (putting on lipstick) Sorry pal, wish I could help you out.

speaker: FRANK
words: They're not coming?

speaker: GEORGE
words: No, they had plans.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: How could they have plans?

speaker: GEORGE
words: That's what I wanna know.

speaker: FRANK
words: Well what difference does it make? They wouldn't lie to us, they're are dear friends.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: What am I supposed to do with all this Paella?

speaker: GEORGE
words: They said tomorrow, maybe.

speaker: FRANK
words: Maybe?

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Maybe they don't like us.

speaker: FRANK

words: Ok it's a deal

words: Moths are a discourage to my business, all it takes is one moth to lay eggs. You know what happens to the larvae? They hatch and they're everywhere.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm sorry, umm he-here's your money back (gives Rudy the money back) I-I-I'll have the clothes.

words: (counting the money to make sure it's all there) It's already put a dent in my fumigation bill.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So uh where are the clothes?

speaker: RUDY
words: I burned 'em.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh. That's good.

speaker: ELAINE
words: N-I know they're your parents Jerry an' they're very nice people. But don't you think it's odd, that a thirty-five year old man is going to these lengths to see that someone else's parents are enjoying themselves? I mean don't you find that abnormal?

speaker: JERRY
words: It is a tad askew.

speaker: ELAINE
words: I mean they're your parents and you don't do anything. So why is this stranger doing it?

speaker: JERRY
words: I've hardly been out to dinner with them.

speaker: ELAINE
words: See, See, I can't even say anything you know because all he's really doing is being nice but but nobody is this nice, this is like certifiably nice.

speaker: JERRY
words: You're right he's insane.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yes, he's insane, that's what I think.

speaker: JERRY
words: So what are you going to do?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I don't know, I don't know what to do. (sighs) Oh god.... so how was the movie?

speaker: JERRY
words: Uh from what I saw it was pretty good.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Ya what do you mean from what you saw?

speaker: JERRY
words: Well I um I didn't ah actually get to see the whole movie.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yea why not?

speaker: JERRY
words: I was kind of um (pauses) making out.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (thinks for a second) You were making, out during Schindler's List?

speaker: JERRY
words: I couldn't help it. We hadn't been alone in a long time, it just got the better of me.

speaker: ELAINE
words: During Schindler's List?

speaker: JERRY
words: (trying to justify it) We're both living with our parents.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Did anybody see you? Did anyone say anything?

speaker: JERRY
words: No I don't think so. I saw Newman as I was leaving but see me.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Hello Mrs. Seinfeld

speaker: HELEN
words: (like Jerry) Hello, Newman. Jerry's not here. (goes to shut the door on him)

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Uh ah (stops her from closing the door; walks in) Having a nice trip? (walks over, grabs a junior mint, smells it then puts it in his pocket)

speaker: HELEN
words: Wonderful, we went to the theater last night.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Oh the theater. Because I was wondering.

speaker: HELEN
words: Wondering what?

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Why I didn't see you at Schindler's List with Jerry.

speaker: HELEN
words: Well we already saw it.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Oh, well it's a good thing for Jerry that you didn't go.

speaker: MORTY
words: (getting up from the table and coming over) Why is that?

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Well he really seemed to have his hands full if you know what I mean.

speaker: HELEN
words: I'm afraid I don't.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Him and his little buxom friend Rachel were going at it pretty good in the balcony.

speaker: MORTY
words: What?

speaker: NEWMAN
words: What, do I have to spell it out for ya? He was moving on her like the storm-troopers into Poland.

speaker: HELEN
words: Jerry was necking during Schindler's List?

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Yes! A more offensive spectacle I cannot recall. Anyway I just really came up to get some detergent.

speaker: HELEN
words: Jerry sends his laundry out.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (laughing) Oh ho right. Well very nice seeing you folks and a by the way you didn't hear this from me. Tata (runs down the hallway laughing)

speaker: JERRY
words: Hi (takes off his coat and puts it on the counter at which point his parents are both right by him as he goes into the refrigerator. He grabs a drink then turns around to see his parents right there) What? What did I do?

speaker: HELEN
words: How could you?

speaker: JERRY
words: How could I what?

speaker: HELEN
words: You were making out during Schindler's List?

words: What? No.

words: Don't lie Jerry.

speaker: JERRY
words: (turns) Newman.

speaker: HELEN
words: How could you do such a thing?

speaker: JERRY
words: I couldn't help it. We hadn't been alone together in a long time and we just kinda started up a little during the coming attractions and the next thing we knew, the war was over.

speaker: JERRY
words: (answering the phone) Hello.

speaker: JACK
words: Hello Jerry, it's Jack Klompus.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hang on a second. (handing Morty the phone) Dad it's Klompus.

speaker: MORTY
words: Hello

words: Hello Morty, listen that key doesn't work. It's no good.

words: You didn't get in?

words: Oh I got in, I had to break the window with a rock and then I got my hand all cut up reaching in.

speaker: MORTY
words: You broke the window?

speaker: HELEN
words: He broke the window?

words: You wanted those damn boxes didn't you?

words: (off camera) He should be on his hands and knees thanking you.

words: Did you send them?

words: Yea, they'll be there tomorrow afternoon, two o'clock.

words: Tomorrow afternoon?

words: Tomorrow afternoon?

speaker: JERRY
words: Tomorrow afternoon?

words: I told you to send them express.

words: W-well it was ten dollars cheaper in the afternoon than the morning, I figured what the hell's the difference.

words: So what did you do about the window?

speaker: JACK
words: I gotta fix your window now?

speaker: MORTY
words: All right all right. Goodbye. (Morty hangs up the phone, Jack hangs up the phone) I don't think we are gonna make that flight.

words: Well what's the difference we'll go some place else.

words: You don't understand, I've come this far, I can't stop now.

words: I can't believe that you're doing all this just to sell some stupid raincoats.

speaker: MORTY
words: You don't understand fashion is cyclical this thing could come back.

words: I think you're out of your mind.

words: Moths?

words: Moths, ate three boxes?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well you know what happens with larvae hatch, they-they're everywhere.

words: You know, I was thinking today. I never liked those Seinfelds anyway, he's an idiot all together. (Knocking at the door) Ah there's Kramer.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (from outside) Hello?

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Hello

words: (still outside) Helowwwowwow (Estelle opens the door) Hey (kisses Estelle hello) Ha ha, Good evening (George waves)

speaker: KRAMER

speaker: FRANK
words: That shirt, where'd you get that shirt?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Wha?

speaker: FRANK
words: That's my cabana shirt, you stole my shirt you son of a bitch! (really fast) George you let your friends go up in my attic and steal my clothes? (grabbing at the shirt) Gimme that back

speaker: KRAMER
words: (trying to get away) woah

speaker: GEORGE
words: Dad?!

words: (laughs as Frank ends up tickling him; gets away) I bought it from Rudy.

words: Who's Rudy? What clothes?

words: You sold my clothes (smacks George on the forehead) what do you mean you sold my clothes?

words: I didn't think you wore them anymore.

speaker: FRANK
words: It's cruise wear!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Kramer, I love that shirt.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yaya

speaker: FRANK
words: THAT'S BECAUSE IT'S MINE!!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: You look just like Frank, on our honeymoon.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, well, thank you.

speaker: FRANK
words: Who's this Rudy?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well Rudy's the guy buying Morty's raincoats.

speaker: FRANK
words: Mory Seinfeld? He's a bum.

words: Well, the whole deal going down tomorrow. Morty's gonna miss his plane for it.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yea.

words: Well I suppose they are wasted.

words: Yes I suppose they are.

words: Tomorrow I'm going straight down to this Rudy and get my clothes.

speaker: KRAMER
words: A mouse!

words: You want the tickets?

words: Yes.

words: Oh it's a orgiastic feast for the senses. The want and the festival, the sites, sounds, and colors an mmmummumm mumm

words: This is it.

words: That's giving it away. This is a one of a kind item.

words: Just watch me do my thing.

speaker: MORTY
words: Look at this. Look at how this idiot packed it. He didn't tape it, he just flipped the flaps. (Kramer, Morty and Jerry are looking around grabbing raincoats which are scattered all over the place.) Kramer you missed a couple.

words: Bon-jour, welcome to the Gateway to Paris Charter Flight.

words: (turns around noticing the Charter flight) Dad isn't that your charter group?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Honesty, hard-work, these are the values that I was raised on. The most important thing Joey, is to be able to look yourself in the mirror before you go to sleep at night.

words: Hey! I got news for you four eyes, there's no way you're staying with us in Paris.

words: You burned them? Those clothes are not yours to burn.

words: Who are you anyways?

words: I'm the father.

words: He said his father was dead.

words: He said I was dead?

speaker: RUDY
words: That's right. Squeezed an extra twenty-five dollars out of me.

speaker: FRANK
words: That's what my life is worth to him? Twenty-five dollars.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, Frank!

words: Oh, I just want to you know I'm retracting our dinner invitation.

speaker: FRANK
words: I'm retracting that it was ever offered.

speaker: MORTY

speaker: MORTY

(Jerry and Elaine look at each other like he's crazy) Water, they need some water (turns around and runs to the Flight Agent)

speaker: AARON

speaker: JERRY
words: Hi Mr. Goldstein is Rachel home?

words: I'm afraid Rachel's not going to be able to see you tonight, or any other night for that matter.

speaker: JERRY
words: Why what did I do?

speaker: MR. GOLDSTEIN
words: (Rachel is know seen behind her Dad) You know very well. I heard about your behavior at the movies the other night it was disgraceful. You should be ashamed of yourself, I for one will not allow my daughter to be involved with someone of such weak moral fiber. Fortunately my postman happened to have witnessed the entire incident. A heavy set fellow, I believe he lives in your building. (Jerry turns to almost do a 'Newman') Now if you don't mind. (starts to close the door)

speaker: JERRY
words: Rachel!

speaker: MR. GOLDSTEIN
words: (closing the door on Jerry) Good night!

speaker: JERRY
words: Rachel!

speaker: JERRY
words: So my parents get home, they open the door, my father flicks the light on, the whole place is cleaned out, everything.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Aahh, (pushes Jerry from her seat at the table) Get Out! How did it happen?

speaker: JERRY
words: The broken window, Klompus never fixed it. They just walked right in.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oohh, boy. They could use a vacation.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yea they're taking one, the travel agent is trying to set something else up for them.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (sighs) So how about that Aaron?

speaker: JERRY
words: Whew

words: You know what drove me crazy about him? Did you ever notice that he stood too close to you when he talked?

speaker: JERRY
words: No I hadn't noticed.

words: (at the counter) Pair of bear claws please.

words: (hearing Newman turns and sees him) Hiya Newman.

words: (moving away from the counter getting closer to the door) Hello Jerry.

speaker: JERRY
words: Say, I happened to catch you coming out of Schindler's List the other night.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Ohh, were you there?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes I was.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (looking scared) I-it's a it's a...powerful film.

words: (couple quick breaths) Shocking.

words: Yes, well that was nothing.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (running out the door) Jerry! Jerry!

words: Where the hell is your father?!

words: This is the best thing we ever did.

words: I just hope those exterminators know what they're doing.

words: Ah forget about them let's just...

speaker: THE END
words: THE END

speaker: MORTY
words: I came home one night, and I tripped over one of Jerry's toys. (Jerry smiling points to himself and nods with cards in his hands) So I took out my belt just to threaten him, and I got a glimpse of myself in the mirror.

speaker: KRAMER
words: How serendipitous.

speaker: MORTY
words: So that night I cut off the loops and the Executive was born.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Mmm

words: He also came up with an idea for a brimless rain-hat but that never materialized. (to Morty) Alright come on let's play.

words: Ah come on.

words: Just a second. (Goes to grab the phone)

words: Jerry have you seen Schindler's List?

words: You have to

words: Ya

speaker: MORTY
words: It's Morty

speaker: JACK
words: Who died?

words: Nobody died. Jack I want you to do me a big favor. (Jerry holding up some cards looking at his father) In my garage there are a couple of boxes.

words: What boxes?

speaker: MORTY
words: I'm gonna explain what boxes.

speaker: JACK
words: Alright how the hell do I know?

words: Anyway there are these three big boxes, you can't miss them. I want you to ship them here to New York for me.

speaker: JACK
words: I thought you're going to Paris

speaker: MORTY
words: I'm still going to Paris. I got a big deal cooking here.

words: What's in the boxes?

words: Raincoats.

speaker: JACK
words: Raincoats? (Doris sighs) You think you're gonna sell those old crappy raincoats? That's garbage.

speaker: HELEN
words: I guarantee you Doris is not letting him mail those boxes.

speaker: JACK
words: When do you want these?

speaker: MORTY
words: Send them tomorrow.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: You think they're coming tonight?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I dunno they said maybe.

speaker: FRANK
words: Of course they're coming, they're leaving soon. If they don't come tonight they might not see us.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Well they better come, I got all this Paella.

speaker: FRANK
words: I admire Morty and Helen going to France. We should take a trip, maybe a cruise.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes a cruise, a long cruise, just the two of you.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Georgie what were you doing poking around the attic last night?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I-I wasn't in the attic.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: I heard noise.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Maybe it was a mouse.

speaker: FRANK
words: (jumping to his feet) OK that's it! We're moving!

speaker: GEORGE
words: What?

speaker: FRANK
words: I will not tolerate infestation.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You haven't even seen one.

speaker: FRANK
words: Don't you understand the very thought, the very idea, I'll never be comfortable again.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: All right Frank that's enough.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I guess I've been hanging on to them for so long cuz i couldn't accept the fact that Dad was really gone forever (hugs a piece of clothing)

speaker: RUDY
words: Uh huh.

speaker: GEORGE
words: They will get a good home won't they?

speaker: RUDY
words: Look I gotta be honest with you there's nothing here too spectacular.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh I beg to differ. My father took great pride in his appearance, he was a very handsome man, a Casanova really.

speaker: RUDY
words: I'll give you uh two-hundred dollars for the three boxes.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Could you make it two-twenty-five that was his hi-game in bowling.

speaker: RUDY
words: Yea I'm in a good mood here.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Thank you.

words: Hey, George what are you doing here?

words: Uh, I'm just selling some of Dad's things, (looking into Kramer's eyes) that's what he would have wanted.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, I gotcha (clicks)

speaker: GEORGE
words: (leaving) That'll do.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh hey guess what. Morty Seinfeld and I are going into business together, selling raincoats.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey that's swell.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yea we worked it out all over dinner last night.

words: Dinner? (grabs Kramer)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ya.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You had dinner with the Seinfelds?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yea, last night.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Was this something you had planned for a while?

speaker: KRAMER
words: No it was a spur of the moment. Well you know Morty likes to fly by the seat of his vintage pants.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (hurriedly leaves Rudy's) They had plans, They had plans!

words: Oooo, boy I've never seen these before (looking at the clothes George just sold Rudy)

words: Well they just came in, part of my spring-time cruise collection. Two for twenty-five dollars.

words: Oh I'll take these.

speaker: RUDY
words: All right

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, remember this raincoat that you sold me?

words: Sure that's the Executive.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ya, you have any others?

speaker: RUDY
words: I wish. They don't make 'em anymore.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Suppose I told you I had fifty in mint condition, would you be interested?

speaker: RUDY
words: Very interested

speaker: KRAMER
words: Cuz they're coming in from Florida as we speak.

speaker: RUDY
words: Well bring 'em in.

speaker: KRAMER
words: So you'll buy them?

speaker: RUDY
words: I don't see what would possibly stop me.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Aaaa (looking around for Jerry) aaaa (finds Jerry) Ah ha. They had plans huh? They were busy. They were busy with their (doing a little dance to make the plans seem all that important) big plans!

speaker: JERRY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Mom and Pop Seinfeld

speaker: JERRY
words: Look I don't know.

speaker: GEORGE
words: All right I happen to know what they did last night, they had dinner with Kramer.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh they were tired it was a last minute thing.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So what's the deal they don't want to have dinner with my parents?

speaker: JERRY
words: That's right.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Is there something wrong with my parents?

speaker: JERRY
words: Absolutely

speaker: GEORGE
words: Because my parents happen to be two pretty wonderful people.

speaker: JERRY
words: These the people you currently live with?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes.

speaker: JERRY
words: Uh huh

speaker: GEORGE
words: So are they coming tonight or not?

speaker: JERRY
words: Look I really don't know what they're plans are.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ok, fine. It's going to be very interesting, very interesting if they don't show up tonight. You know my mother made all this Paella.

speaker: JERRY
words: What is that anyway?

speaker: GEORGE
words: It's a Spanish dish. It's a mlange of fish, an meat with rice. Very tasty.

speaker: JERRY
words: I-I'll tell 'em

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey could you do one other thing for me?

speaker: JERRY
words: Name it.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You think your parents would have any objections to taking a little kid to Paris with them? (Jerry looks at him confused) It turns out that the kid's father lives in Paris. (chuckling) Is that a coincidence? (Jerry smiles) Eh you know Alec wants me to take him over there so I figure as long as they're going (claps)

speaker: JERRY
words: So you thought as long as they're mailing postcards, it wouldn't be too much to ask my parents to drag a child who they've never seen, through the streets of Paris?

speaker: GEORGE
words: (pause) All right if you think it's too much they don't have to mail the postcards.

speaker: JOANNE
words: So where's he taking you?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well first we're going to a matinee, I'm taking the afternoon off, we're gonna go see "My Fair Lady" and they we are gonna go to dinner. He knows all these fantastic places.

speaker: JOANNE
words: You are one lucky girl. (Elaine laughs in happiness) Wish I could find a nice guy. (Joanne goes to leave; Aaron enters) Hi Aaron.

speaker: AARON
words: (getting up in Aaron's face) Hey Joanne. (turns to Elaine and goes over to her) Hey

speaker: ELAINE
words: (already out from behind her desk goes to Aaron) Hi

speaker: HELEN
words: Hello, Hello.

speaker: MORTY
words: Hello Elaine

speaker: AARON
words: I was able to finagle two more tickets to "My Fair Lady" and I thought why not ask Morty and Helen.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, Great.

speaker: MORTY
words: (looking around) This is some office. What's the square footage?

speaker: HELEN
words: You don't mind to you Elaine?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Mind? Oh o-of course not.

speaker: AARON
words: We can make a whole day of it.

speaker: MORTY
words: This is some building, Harry Fleming used to have an office here. There was a deli on the first floor. You don't get corned beef like that anymore. What happened to that deli?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (somewhat annoyed) I really don't know Mr. Seinfeld

speaker: JERRY
words: (stopping them) We better not. (they make out some more; then stop) T-They're gonna be here any second.

speaker: RACHEL
words: When are they leaving?

speaker: JERRY
words: In two days.

speaker: RACHEL
words: It's been soo long.

speaker: JERRY
words: I know.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Ok, it's only two more days.

speaker: JERRY
words: Right, Thursday three o'clock.

speaker: MORTY
words: (from outside the door; singing) I could have danced all night (entering with Helen) I could have danced all night and still have

speaker: HELEN
words: Ooh.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh Hi.

speaker: HELEN
words: We didn't know you had company.

speaker: JERRY
words: (tucking in his shirt) Oh ya this is Rachel.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hi.

speaker: HELEN
words: Uh we'll come back another time.

speaker: JERRY
words: What other time?

speaker: HELEN
words: Whenever

speaker: JERRY
words: Where you goin'?

speaker: MORTY
words: Uh we'll drive around for a while.

speaker: JERRY
words: You don't have a car.

speaker: MORTY
words: We'll take a bus.

speaker: JERRY
words: Come on stop.

speaker: HELEN
words: No we don't mind

speaker: MORTY
words: I'll get a book.

speaker: RACHEL
words: No no it's ok, I was just leaving anyway.

speaker: HELEN
words: O-oh are you sure?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yea.

speaker: HELEN
words: Cuz we don't wann..

speaker: JERRY
words: (interrupting) No no it's ok. (walking Rachel out) So we'll go see Schindler's List later right?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Definitely

speaker: JERRY
words: Ok.Uh

speaker: RACHEL
words: (going out the door) It's night meeting you.

speaker: HELEN
words: Nice meeting you.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ok, see you later.

speaker: MORTY
words: Boy that was some show.

speaker: JERRY
words: What show?

speaker: MORTY
words: "My Fair Lady"

speaker: JERRY
words: When did you get tickets to see that?

speaker: HELEN
words: Aaron surprised us, and Elaine came.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh (laughing) Elaine really? Well that sounds interesting.

speaker: MORTY
words: We saw Regis Philbin get out of a limousine.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh.

speaker: HELEN
words: He looks better on TV.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh

speaker: JERRY
words: (answering phone) Hello?

speaker: JACK
words: Hello Jerry,

speaker: JERRY
words: Yea.

speaker: JACK
words: It's Jack Klompus.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh hi Jack.

speaker: JACK
words: So when are you coming down to Florida again?

speaker: JERRY
words: As soon as is humanly possible.

speaker: JACK
words: You know I still got that pen, the one that writes upside down.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yea yea ya I shoulda kept it.

speaker: JACK
words: So uh where's your father?

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya he's right here.

speaker: MORTY
words: Yea

speaker: JACK
words: Morty, listen I can't get into the garage.

speaker: MORTY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: JACK
words: There is something wrong with the key. The key doesn't work

speaker: MORTY
words: You gotta jiggle it a little bit. I jiggled it. I jiggled it for fifteen minutes.

speaker: DORIS
words: Tell him to come down here and get his own packages. You have nothing better to do then worry about his boxes.

speaker: MORTY
words: You gotta pull on the knob as you turn it.

speaker: JACK
words: Get the hell outta here with your knob.

speaker: DORIS
words: What does he want from you?

speaker: MORTY
words: My idiot son could open that garage door.

speaker: JERRY
words: What did I do?

speaker: MORTY
words: Just do it first thing tomorrow. I need it.

speaker: MORTY
words: They'll be here first thing Thursday morning.

speaker: HELEN
words: Thursday morning? You know we're leaving at three o'clock.

speaker: JERRY
words: (in a hurry) Yea you're leaving at three o'clock.

speaker: HELEN
words: How are you gonna get all this done in time?

speaker: MORTY
words: Don't worry about it.

speaker: JERRY
words: (in a hurry) Ya how you gonna get all this done in time?

speaker: GEORGE
words: They were drinking champagne in a buggy!

speaker: FRANK
words: First Kramer, then Elaine?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yea

speaker: FRANK
words: It's a slap in the face.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: (with her arms out in wonder) What did we ever do to them? (George puts his arms out and imitates Estelle as she moves her arms up and down as she speaks) I want to know what we did them!

speaker: FRANK
words: What are they too good for us? A raincoat salesman, I could buy and sell 'em like that.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: The hell with them.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (in the threshold between the living room and the kitchen) The thing that bothers me the most, is the lying.

speaker: FRANK
words: Let's forget about it. We're going on a beautiful vacation. (sits down in his chair)

speaker: GEORGE
words: (sitting down) Vacation?

speaker: FRANK
words: You're mother and I are planning on taking a cruise.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (claps all happy) AH! (half hugs Estelle)

speaker: FRANK
words: But I can't find any vacation clothes. They were in the attic.

speaker: GEORGE
words: The attic? Y-you haven't wore any of those clothes for years.

speaker: FRANK
words: How can I go on a cruise with out my cabana wear? I love those, those clothes. (Looks down yells) AH! (jumps out of his chair) A mouse! I saw a mouse! (takes off into another room with glass doors on it and shuts the door)

speaker: GEORGE
words: (picking up what Frank saw as a mouse) It's the remote.

speaker: FRANK
words: (looking from the room; you can see him through the glass) Where the hell are my clothes? I love those clothes.

speaker: RUDY
words: Lousy moth ridden crap.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey.

speaker: MORTY
words: Hey, Jerry.

speaker: HELEN
words: So how was the movie?

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, really good, really good.

speaker: HELEN
words: And didn't the three hours go by just like that (snaps her fingers)

speaker: JERRY
words: Like that (snaps his fingers)

speaker: MORTY
words: What about the end, with the list?

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya that was some list.

speaker: HELEN
words: What did you think about the black and white?

speaker: JERRY
words: (confused) The black and white.

speaker: MORTY
words: The whole movie was in black and white.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh yea, I didn't even realize.

speaker: MORTY
words: You don't even think about it, there's so much going on.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ya ya, I tell ya I could see it again.

speaker: KRAMER
words: So Klompus has the key, but the jerk couldn't open it up. All you gotta do it jiggle it (has is hand out jiggling) jus get it in there (jiggling making a bunch of noises) jigg jigg jiggle reiggle

speaker: RUDY
words: Look, I find this whole thing very uninteresting. When you get the coats come in.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey what again?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm trying to buy some of the clothes back. (realizing something) Hey you wanna come over for dinner tonight? My mother made all this extra Paella.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Payaya, ya I'll be there.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Apparently the Seinfelds' are too good for us. I shouldn't say anything bad about your uh your partner.

speaker: KRAMER
words: No no you know we're not partners. I only get twenty-five percent.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Twenty-five percent? It was your idea.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yap I know.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You're doing all the leg work.

speaker: KRAMER
words: That's right

speaker: GEORGE
words: He's ripping you off

speaker: KRAMER
words: You're right he's ripping me off

speaker: GEORGE
words: If anybody should be getting more it's you.

speaker: KRAMER
words: He's ripping me off

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well don't let him take advantage of you like that.

speaker: KRAMER
words: YAH! (exits)

speaker: RUDY
words: (coming out of the back-room noticing George) Oh it's you? You're the one who sold me the moth ridden cabana crap.

speaker: MORTY
words: You know I've been thinking, why is Kramer getting twenty-five percent?

speaker: HELEN
words: Well he told you about the place.

speaker: MORTY
words: So what, why is that worth twenty-five percent? It's a finders fee. You know what a finders fee is?

speaker: HELEN
words: You find something you get a fee.

speaker: MORTY
words: Finder's fee is ten percent and no more.

speaker: HELEN
words: Well it's too late now.

speaker: MORTY
words: Those are my coats. I saved them, I stored them, I've been waiting years for this pay off.

speaker: HELEN
words: Well you're not gonna say anything.

speaker: KRAMER
words: I've been thinking about something.

speaker: MORTY
words: Ya so have I

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ahh! I don't think the deal is fair.

speaker: MORTY
words: You don't think it's fair.

speaker: KRAMER
words: No no, I found the place, I set the whole thing up, I'm doing all the leg work.

speaker: MORTY
words: What leg work?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, there's leg work.

speaker: MORTY
words: If anything you're getting too much.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Too much?!

speaker: MORTY
words: That's right, they're my coats.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Look I want thirty-five percent.

speaker: MORTY
words: I'm thinking more like fifteen.

speaker: KRAMER
words: No way I'm taking fifteen.

speaker: MORTY
words: Well you're not getting thirty-five.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Alright let's compromise. Twenty-five percent.

speaker: MORTY
words: Ok it's a deal

speaker: RUDY
words: Moths are a discourage to my business, all it takes is one moth to lay eggs. You know what happens to the larvae? They hatch and they're everywhere.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm sorry, umm he-here's your money back (gives Rudy the money back) I-I-I'll have the clothes.

speaker: RUDY
words: (counting the money to make sure it's all there) It's already put a dent in my fumigation bill.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So uh where are the clothes?

speaker: RUDY
words: I burned 'em.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh. That's good.

speaker: ELAINE
words: N-I know they're your parents Jerry an' they're very nice people. But don't you think it's odd, that a thirty-five year old man is going to these lengths to see that someone else's parents are enjoying themselves? I mean don't you find that abnormal?

speaker: JERRY
words: It is a tad askew.

speaker: ELAINE
words: I mean they're your parents and you don't do anything. So why is this stranger doing it?

speaker: JERRY
words: I've hardly been out to dinner with them.

speaker: ELAINE
words: See, See, I can't even say anything you know because all he's really doing is being nice but but nobody is this nice, this is like certifiably nice.

speaker: JERRY
words: You're right he's insane.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yes, he's insane, that's what I think.

words: So what are you going to do?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I don't know, I don't know what to do. (sighs) Oh god.... so how was the movie?

speaker: JERRY
words: Uh from what I saw it was pretty good.

words: Ya what do you mean from what you saw?

speaker: JERRY
words: Well I um I didn't ah actually get to see the whole movie.

words: Yea why not?

speaker: JERRY
words: I was kind of um (pauses) making out.

words: (thinks for a second) You were making, out during Schindler's List?
