words: I couldn't help it. We hadn't been alone in a long time, it just got the better of me.

speaker: ELAINE
words: During Schindler's List?

speaker: JERRY
words: (trying to justify it) We're both living with our parents.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Did anybody see you? Did anyone say anything?

speaker: JERRY
words: No I don't think so. I saw Newman as I was leaving but see me.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Hello Mrs. Seinfeld

words: (like Jerry) Hello, Newman. Jerry's not here. (goes to shut the door on him)

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Uh ah (stops her from closing the door; walks in) Having a nice trip? (walks over, grabs a junior mint, smells it then puts it in his pocket)

words: Wonderful, we went to the theater last night.

words: Oh the theater. Because I was wondering.

speaker: HELEN
words: Wondering what?

words: Why I didn't see you at Schindler's List with Jerry.

speaker: HELEN
words: Well we already saw it.

words: Oh, well it's a good thing for Jerry that you didn't go.

speaker: MORTY
words: (getting up from the table and coming over) Why is that?

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Well he really seemed to have his hands full if you know what I mean.

speaker: HELEN
words: I'm afraid I don't.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Him and his little buxom friend Rachel were going at it pretty good in the balcony.

speaker: MORTY
words: What?

speaker: NEWMAN
words: What, do I have to spell it out for ya? He was moving on her like the storm-troopers into Poland.

speaker: HELEN
words: Jerry was necking during Schindler's List?

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Yes! A more offensive spectacle I cannot recall. Anyway I just really came up to get some detergent.

speaker: HELEN
words: Jerry sends his laundry out.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (laughing) Oh ho right. Well very nice seeing you folks and a by the way you didn't hear this from me. Tata (runs down the hallway laughing)

speaker: JERRY
words: Hi (takes off his coat and puts it on the counter at which point his parents are both right by him as he goes into the refrigerator. He grabs a drink then turns around to see his parents right there) What? What did I do?

speaker: HELEN
words: How could you?

speaker: JERRY
words: How could I what?

speaker: HELEN
words: You were making out during Schindler's List?

words: What? No.

speaker: MORTY
words: Don't lie Jerry.

speaker: JERRY
words: (turns) Newman.

speaker: HELEN
words: How could you do such a thing?

speaker: JERRY
words: I couldn't help it. We hadn't been alone together in a long time and we just kinda started up a little during the coming attractions and the next thing we knew, the war was over.

speaker: JERRY
words: (answering the phone) Hello.

speaker: JACK
words: Hello Jerry, it's Jack Klompus.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hang on a second. (handing Morty the phone) Dad it's Klompus.

speaker: MORTY
words: Hello

speaker: JACK
words: Hello Morty, listen that key doesn't work. It's no good.

speaker: MORTY
words: You didn't get in?

speaker: JACK
words: Oh I got in, I had to break the window with a rock and then I got my hand all cut up reaching in.

speaker: MORTY
words: You broke the window?

speaker: HELEN
words: He broke the window?

speaker: JACK
words: You wanted those damn boxes didn't you?

speaker: DORIS
words: (off camera) He should be on his hands and knees thanking you.

speaker: MORTY
words: Did you send them?

speaker: JACK
words: Yea, they'll be there tomorrow afternoon, two o'clock.

speaker: MORTY
words: Tomorrow afternoon?

speaker: HELEN
words: Tomorrow afternoon?

speaker: JERRY
words: Tomorrow afternoon?

speaker: MORTY
words: I told you to send them express.

speaker: JACK
words: W-well it was ten dollars cheaper in the afternoon than the morning, I figured what the hell's the difference.

speaker: MORTY
words: So what did you do about the window?

speaker: JACK
words: I gotta fix your window now?

speaker: MORTY
words: All right all right. Goodbye. (Morty hangs up the phone, Jack hangs up the phone) I don't think we are gonna make that flight.

speaker: JERRY
words: W-what do you mean you're not making the flight?

speaker: HELEN
words: We have to make the flight, we're with a charter group. If we don't the trip is off.

speaker: MORTY
words: Well what's the difference we'll go some place else.

speaker: HELEN
words: Some place else? What about Paris?

speaker: MORTY
words: You don't understand, I've come this far, I can't stop now.

speaker: HELEN
words: I can't believe that you're doing all this just to sell some stupid raincoats.

speaker: MORTY
words: You don't understand fashion is cyclical this thing could come back.

speaker: HELEN
words: I think you're out of your mind.

speaker: FRANK
words: I just don't understand how all those clothes can disappear.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Moths?

speaker: FRANK
words: Moths, ate three boxes?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well you know what happens with larvae hatch, they-they're everywhere.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: You know, I was thinking today. I never liked those Seinfelds anyway, he's an idiot all together. (Knocking at the door) Ah there's Kramer.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (from outside) Hello?

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Hello

speaker: KRAMER
words: (still outside) Helowwwowwow (Estelle opens the door) Hey (kisses Estelle hello) Ha ha, Good evening (George waves)

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Hope you're hungry. (goes into the kitchen)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ooo Paella

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey uh let me take you're coat.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (giving George his coat) Oh ya thanks buddy.

speaker: FRANK
words: That shirt, where'd you get that shirt?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Wha?

speaker: FRANK
words: That's my cabana shirt, you stole my shirt you son of a bitch! (really fast) George you let your friends go up in my attic and steal my clothes? (grabbing at the shirt) Gimme that back

speaker: KRAMER
words: (trying to get away) woah

speaker: GEORGE
words: Dad?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: (laughs as Frank ends up tickling him; gets away) I bought it from Rudy.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Rudy?! That skunk, I knew he didn't burn those clothes.

speaker: FRANK
words: Who's Rudy? What clothes?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I sold your clothes yesterday.

speaker: FRANK
words: You sold my clothes (smacks George on the forehead) what do you mean you sold my clothes?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I didn't think you wore them anymore.

speaker: FRANK
words: It's cruise wear!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Kramer, I love that shirt.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yaya

speaker: FRANK
words: THAT'S BECAUSE IT'S MINE!!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: You look just like Frank, on our honeymoon.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, well, thank you.

speaker: FRANK
words: Who's this Rudy?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well Rudy's the guy buying Morty's raincoats.

speaker: FRANK
words: Mory Seinfeld? He's a bum.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, the whole deal going down tomorrow. Morty's gonna miss his plane for it.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Missing his plane? Wasn't that a charter flight?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yea.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What happens to charter tickets when you don't use em?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well I suppose they are wasted.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes I suppose they are.

speaker: FRANK
words: Tomorrow I'm going straight down to this Rudy and get my clothes.

speaker: KRAMER
words: A mouse!

speaker: JERRY
words: You want the tickets?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes.

speaker: JERRY
words: You're gonna take this kid to Paris?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey I get a free trip to Paris, I go in the Big Brother's Hall-of-Fame, I mail my own postcards.

speaker: JERRY
words: You know I'm paying for these tickets.

speaker: GEORGE
words: It's alright, I got lunch.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, you should have gone to the Costanzas' for dinner. Mmm the Payaya was magnificent. Have you ever had really good Paella?

speaker: MORTY
words: Not really.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh it's a orgiastic feast for the senses. The want and the festival, the sites, sounds, and colors an mmmummumm mumm

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey Dad are you sure we are at the right carousel?

speaker: MORTY
words: This is it.

speaker: KRAMER
words: So how much are we gonna make?

speaker: MORTY
words: Take it easy, I've been through a million of these negotiations.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Wha two thousand? Three thousand?

speaker: MORTY
words: That's giving it away. This is a one of a kind item.

speaker: KRAMER
words: More? More than three thousand?

speaker: MORTY
words: Just watch me do my thing.

speaker: JERRY
words: Say Dad, (pointing at a raincoat sitting on the carousel next to an open box) isn't that one of yours?

speaker: MORTY
words: Look at this. Look at how this idiot packed it. He didn't tape it, he just flipped the flaps. (Kramer, Morty and Jerry are looking around grabbing raincoats which are scattered all over the place.) Kramer you missed a couple.

speaker: WOMAN
words: Bon-jour, welcome to the Gateway to Paris Charter Flight.

speaker: JERRY
words: (turns around noticing the Charter flight) Dad isn't that your charter group?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Honesty, hard-work, these are the values that I was raised on. The most important thing Joey, is to be able to look yourself in the mirror before you go to sleep at night.

speaker: JOEY
words: Hey! I got news for you four eyes, there's no way you're staying with us in Paris.

speaker: FRANK
words: You burned them? Those clothes are not yours to burn.

speaker: RUDY
words: Who are you anyways?

speaker: FRANK
words: I'm the father.

speaker: RUDY
words: He said his father was dead.

speaker: FRANK
words: He said I was dead?

speaker: RUDY
words: That's right. Squeezed an extra twenty-five dollars out of me.

speaker: FRANK
words: That's what my life is worth to him? Twenty-five dollars.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, Frank!

speaker: FRANK
words: Oh, I just want to you know I'm retracting our dinner invitation.

speaker: MORTY
words: Well you don't have to retract it because we never went.

speaker: FRANK
words: I'm retracting that it was ever offered.

speaker: MORTY
words: I retract your retraction.

speaker: FRANK
words: Oh, you trying to unload some of that junk of yours?

speaker: MORTY
words: Would you excuse me please, we're conducting business here.

speaker: RUDY
words: You can keep your raincoats. I'm not interested.

speaker: KRAMER
words: I thought we had a deal?

speaker: FRANK
words: That's another one of my shirts!!

speaker: RUDY
words: I'm not buying anymore clothes from anyone off the street.

speaker: MORTY
words: Who's off the street? I'm in the raincoat business for thirty-five years.

speaker: RUDY
words: Ya how do I know there aren't moths like his stuff?

speaker: FRANK
words: My clothes don't have moths!

speaker: MORTY
words: Because of his moths you're not buying my raincoats?

speaker: RUDY
words: That's right.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (laughing) I'm all ticklish. (a moth flies out of his shirt; they all look at it)

speaker: ANNOUNCEMENT
words: Flight-433 now boarding for Miami, Gate 18a. Flight-433 now boarding.

speaker: MORTY
words: Ok, let's go.

speaker: HELEN
words: (to Aaron) It was so nice of you to come to the airport to see us off.

speaker: AARON
words: Are you sure you can't stay a little longer?

speaker: NO.
words: NO.

speaker: MORTY
words: Ah, good-bye.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Good-bye

speaker: JERRY
words: Take care

speaker: MORTY
words: Alright Jer.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Nice to see..

speaker: MORTY
words: Buh bye Elaine

speaker: JERRY
words: Buh bye.

speaker: HELEN
words: Buh bye.

speaker: HELEN
words: (looking at Jerry while being overly hugged by Aaron) We'll call you when we get home.

speaker: AARON
words: Thank you.

speaker: JERRY
words: I think she meant me, but.

speaker: MORTY
words: Make sure Kramer uses good tape when he sends back the raincoats.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ok.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Bye.

speaker: JERRY
words: Bye.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Aaron? Aaron are you ok?

speaker: AARON
words: I could've done more. I could've done so much more.

speaker: ELAINE
words: You did enough.

speaker: AARON
words: (turning toward her) No, I could've called the travel agency, got them on another flight to Paris, I coulda got them out.

speaker: JERRY
words: You tried Aaron, it was too expensive.

speaker: AARON
words: (holds his arm up) This watch, this watch could've paid for their whole trip. (holds his other hand up) This ring, this ring is one more dinner I could've taken them out to. (Jerry and Elaine look at each other like he's crazy) Water, they need some water (turns around and runs to the Flight Agent)

speaker: ELAINE
words: Why?

speaker: AARON
words: (to the Flight Agent) They'll get dehydrated on the plane! Get the Seinfelds some water. Please! Please!

speaker: JERRY
words: Hi Mr. Goldstein is Rachel home?

speaker: MR. GOLDSTEIN
words: I'm afraid Rachel's not going to be able to see you tonight, or any other night for that matter.

speaker: JERRY
words: Why what did I do?

speaker: MR. GOLDSTEIN
words: (Rachel is know seen behind her Dad) You know very well. I heard about your behavior at the movies the other night it was disgraceful. You should be ashamed of yourself, I for one will not allow my daughter to be involved with someone of such weak moral fiber. Fortunately my postman happened to have witnessed the entire incident. A heavy set fellow, I believe he lives in your building. (Jerry turns to almost do a 'Newman') Now if you don't mind. (starts to close the door)

speaker: JERRY
words: Rachel!

speaker: MR. GOLDSTEIN
words: (closing the door on Jerry) Good night!

speaker: JERRY
words: Rachel!

speaker: JERRY
words: So my parents get home, they open the door, my father flicks the light on, the whole place is cleaned out, everything.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Aahh, (pushes Jerry from her seat at the table) Get Out! How did it happen?

speaker: JERRY
words: The broken window, Klompus never fixed it. They just walked right in.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oohh, boy. They could use a vacation.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yea they're taking one, the travel agent is trying to set something else up for them.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (sighs) So how about that Aaron?

speaker: JERRY
words: Whew

speaker: ELAINE
words: You know what drove me crazy about him? Did you ever notice that he stood too close to you when he talked?

speaker: JERRY
words: No I hadn't noticed.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (at the counter) Pair of bear claws please.

speaker: JERRY
words: (hearing Newman turns and sees him) Hiya Newman.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (moving away from the counter getting closer to the door) Hello Jerry.

speaker: JERRY
words: Say, I happened to catch you coming out of Schindler's List the other night.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: Ohh, were you there?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes I was.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (looking scared) I-it's a it's a...powerful film.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes, shocking brutality don't you think?

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (couple quick breaths) Shocking.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes, well that was nothing.

speaker: NEWMAN
words: (running out the door) Jerry! Jerry!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Where the hell is your father?!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: This is the best thing we ever did.

speaker: FRANK
words: I just hope those exterminators know what they're doing.

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Ah forget about them let's just...

speaker: THE END
words: THE END

speaker: JERRY
words: To me, the thing about birthday parties is that the first birthday party you have and the last birthday party you have are actually quite similar. You know, you just kinda sit there...you're the least excited person at the party. You don't even really realize that there is a party. You don't know what's goin' on. Both birthday parties, people have to kinda help you blow out the candles, you can't do it...you don't even know why you're doing it. What is this ritual? What is going on? It's also the only two birthday parties where other people have to gather your friends together for you. Sometimes they're not even your friends. They make the judgement. They bring 'em in, they sit 'em down, and they tell you - 'these are your friends! Tell them thank you for coming to my birthday party.'

speaker: TOBY
words: These are great! Just great! Really great! Really, really great! Don't you think so, Elaine?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, really great.

speaker: TOBY
words: A coffee table book about coffee tables! (To Kramer) How did you come up with this idea?

speaker: KRAMER
words: It was there!

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh, look at this one! It's saying, 'I'm a coffee table, put some coffee on me! Oh, the hotter the better, that's what I'm here for!' (laughs)

speaker: ELAINE
words: Actually, I've got some work I gotta do, so...

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, how about if the book came with these little fold-out legs...so the book itself becomes a coffee table?

speaker: TOBY
words: Ohhh, that is a great idea! Really, really great!

speaker: ELAINE
words: 'And that coffee table is saying, put some coffee on me!' I'd like to put some coffee on her. Hot, scalding coffee - right in her face! I swear! This is like working with a contestant from "The Price Is Right"! (demonstrates)

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, that's real interesting. Elaine, listen, tell me if you think this is funny - (reads comedy he's written) "Men definitely hit the remote more than women...men don't care what's on TV, men only care what else is on TV. Women want to see what the show is before they change the channel, because men hunt and women nest."

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, it's funny, I dunno.

speaker: JERRY
words: You don't know? Come on, that's gold!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well, I don't know about "gold."

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, that's gold, baby.

speaker: ELAINE
words: 'Baby'? What, are you doing George now?

speaker: JERRY
words: I was saying 'baby' way before George!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well, I don't know, don't ask me any more questions about jokes, Jerry, it puts too much pressure on me.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, this guy Leonard Christian's gonna be there tomorrow night.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, who's he?

speaker: JERRY
words: He's a writer from Entertainment Weekly. I would like to have a good show.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Danke schoen, my little dumplings.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Hi.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, how about that Toby, huh?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, how about her?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ooh, she's a package full of energy!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, she's a package full of something.

speaker: KRAMER
words: And that something is life. Jerry, you gotta meet this gal - she's brimmin' with positivity!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, pleeeeease. (moves to the living room and sits down)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, are you performing tomorrow night?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Great, I'm gonna bring Toby.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, you better laugh 'cause I'm being reviewed. Leonard Christian's gonna be there.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, she's a great laugher - right, Elaine?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh yeah, she's a great laugher, Jerry. (imitates Toby) Really, really great!

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, you want to sit with George? I think he's coming with Robin.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Is that the waitress from the comedy club?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What about her kid, is she bringing him, too?

speaker: KRAMER
words: She's got a kid?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, you should see George get along with this kid!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ow! What are you doing under there? Hey, stop that! Don't eat that! That's not food! (to Robin) He's suckin' down Equal packets!

speaker: ROBIN
words: Do you think 25 kids is too much?

speaker: GEORGE
words: 25 kids for his birthday party? (to kid under table) Don't put your tongue on the floor! He's putting his tongue on the floor! Here, here, have some more sugar packets.

speaker: ROBIN
words: So, what about entertainment? (to kid) Should I get Barney?

speaker: KID
words: No Barney!

speaker: ROBIN
words: Maybe a clown.

speaker: GEORGE
words: How about Bozo?

speaker: KID
words: Who's Bozo?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Who's Bozo? Bozo the Clown, that's who Bozo is. When I was a kid, Bozo the Clown was the clown, bar none.

speaker: ROBIN
words: George...

speaker: GEORGE
words: With the orange hair, and the big clown shirt with the ruffles...

speaker: ROBIN
words: George...

speaker: GEORGE
words: And the TV show! He had cartoons!

speaker: ROBIN
words: George! Forget Bozo, George. Bozo's out. He's finished. It's over for Bozo.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You know, when I was a kid, we didn't have these elaborate birthday parties with catered food and entertainment. I remember my 7th birthday party...

speaker: FRANK
words: Blow out the candles! Blow out the candles, I said! Blow out the damn candles!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Stop it, Frank! You're killing him!

speaker: ROBIN
words: Well, this time, you can blow out the candles.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Nah, I have asthma. (Robin's kid grabs George's leg from under the table, and George struggles.)

speaker: TOBY
words: Hi!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Hi, Toby.

speaker: TOBY
words: How are you doing today?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Fine... (Toby sits and waits for Elaine to speak.) How are you?

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh, I'm great! Just great. Really great! Oh, hey - did you hear about Bob Rosen?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Nope.

speaker: TOBY
words: He is going to Knopp. He is going to be a vice president.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Knopp? Really? Boy. That means there's an opening here for senior editor...has Lippman, uh, hired anyone?

speaker: TOBY
words: No. I hear he wants to promote someone in-house.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Really!

speaker: TOBY
words: Maybe it'll be you!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh...well...

speaker: TOBY
words: You really deserve it. I mean, you have experience, seniority...Lippman really respects your opinion...

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well! Well, it could be you.

speaker: TOBY
words: No...

speaker: ELAINE
words: No, really.

speaker: TOBY
words: Really? You think so?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Sure.

speaker: TOBY
words: Boy, wouldn't that be exciting!

speaker: ELAINE
words: I mean, stranger things have happened...

speaker: TOBY
words: Wow! Me! A senior editor! (deadly serious) I'd like that.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well, you shouldn't get your hopes up, Toby.

speaker: TOBY
words: Well, it's a possibility, like you said! Stranger things have happened! Thank you, Elaine. Thank you. (Exits.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, Ronnie. (To bartender) Can I have a club soda? (To Ronnie) Goin' on tonight?

speaker: RONNIE
words: Yeah. You?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah.

speaker: RONNIE
words: You know Leonard Christian's here?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, I know.

speaker: RONNIE
words: Can I ask you something? Are my nostrils getting bigger?

speaker: JERRY
words: I don't...think so.

speaker: RONNIE
words: Are you sure? Take a good look. They seem a little bigger?

speaker: JERRY
words: I don't...I dunno.

speaker: RONNIE
words: Is it possible for nostrils to expand?

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, is this a bit?

speaker: RONNIE
words: Hey, I don't do "bits." I'm a prop comic. Dammit, I can't find my water gun. I can't go on without my water gun.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, Jerry. Toby, this is Jerry.

speaker: TOBY
words: This is so exciting! Look, I have goosebumps! (To Jerry) Touch! Touch them! (Jerry touches her arm. Toby screeches with excitement.) I've never been to a comedy club before!

speaker: JERRY
words: Really! You know, a lot of restaurants are serving brewed decaf now, too.

speaker: TOBY
words: You are so funny!

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, you'll have a good time, I swear.

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh! He swears like he thinks I don't believe him. I believe you. I believe you! Oh, he's so funny! (laughs)

speaker: KRAMER
words: What about me?

speaker: TOBY
words: What about you? (laughs) I'm only kidding. You're funny, too. I love to laugh.

speaker: JERRY
words: Good, good.

speaker: KRAMER
words: So, you up next?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, why don't you guys get a table so you'll have good seats?

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh yeah, we don't want some jerk sitting in front of us, it'll be like, 'Hey, big head, can you move out of the way? I didn't pay a cover charge to stare at your bald spot.' (laughs)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Alright, so you have a good show, huh buddy?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah.

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh, have a great show. Hey, we'll make sure it's a great show!

speaker: JERRY
words: O.k., good, I'll see you later. (Kramer and Toby are about to exit. She turns around and clutches Kramer's jacket.)

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh, he's so great! This is so great! I'm so excited!

speaker: JERRY
words: Men definitely hit the remote button more than women...

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh, really! Really! That is so true!

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes, yeah...see, men don't care what's on TV, men only care what else is on TV.

speaker: TV.
words: TV.

speaker: TOBY
words: Yes! Yes! Right on! Right on! (Other audience members give her puzzled looks.)

speaker: JERRY
words: See...women really want to see what the show is before they change the channel...

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh, that is so true, yes!

speaker: JERRY
words: ...that's why men hunt and women nest.

speaker: TOBY
words: BOO! BOO! Hiss! Boo! (Toby's obnoxious behavior causes Jerry to completely lose his place and mess up his act.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, what's the deal? What was goin' on there? I invite you down here, I have an important show, and she heckles me?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Look, she didn't mean anything.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, what is the matter with her? Is she crazy?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: She's just being enthusiastic, that's all!

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey! What is wrong with you?!

speaker: TOBY
words: Me? Nothing's wrong with me.

speaker: JERRY
words: You boo me?! You hiss?! You didn't stop blathering throughout the whole set!

speaker: TOBY
words: Oh, come on! I thought you're a pro! That's part of the show.

speaker: JERRY
words: No! Not part of the show! Booing and hissing are not part of the show! You boo puppets! You hiss villains in silent movies!

speaker: TOBY
words: Well, that's the way I express myself. How are you gonna make it in this business if you can't take it?

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, I can take it.

speaker: TOBY
words: Let's go. (Ronnie walks by Jerry.)

speaker: RONNIE
words: Hey, man. Good set.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Bozo?

speaker: ERIC
words: No.

speaker: GEORGE
words: B-O-Z-O?

speaker: ERIC
words: Sorry, I...

speaker: GEORGE
words: You've never heard of Bozo the Clown?

speaker: ERIC
words: No!

speaker: GEORGE
words: How could you not know who Bozo the Clown is?

speaker: ERIC
words: I don't know, I just don't.

speaker: GEORGE
words: How can you call yourself a clown and not know who Bozo is?

speaker: ERIC
words: Hey, man - what are you hassling me for? This is just a gig, it's not my life. I don't know who Bozo is, what - is he a clown?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Is he a clown? What, are you kidding me!?

speaker: ERIC
words: Well, what is he?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes, he's a clown!

speaker: ERIC
words: Alright, so what's the big deal! There's millions of clowns!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Alright, just forget it.

speaker: ERIC
words: Me forget it? You should forget it! You're livin' in the past, man! You're hung up on some clown from the sixties, man!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Alright, very good, very good...go fold your little balloon animals, Eric. Eric! What kind of name is that for a clown, huh?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, I do what I can. (Robin comes over.)

speaker: ROBIN
words: Hi Mom, how's everything?

speaker: ROBIN
words: The burgers should be ready in a minute.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ah, great, great. (sniffs) What's that smell? Smoke? (walks to the kitchen) Hey everybody, I think I smell some smoke back here...(smoke boils into the doorway.) FIRE! FIRE! Get out of the way!

speaker: GEORGE
words: It was an inferno in there! An inferno! (Eric, Robin's mother, and all the kids rush at George.)

speaker: ERIC
words: There he is! That's him! (Tries to clobber George with his big shoe.)

speaker: GEORGE
words: I...was trying to lead the way. We needed a leader! Someone to lead the way to safety.

speaker: ROBIN
words: But you yelled "get out of my way"!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Because! Because, as the leader...if I die...then all hope is lost! Who would lead? The clown? Instead of castigating me, you should all be thanking me. What kind of a topsy-turvy world do we live in, where heroes are cast as villains? Brave men as cowards?

speaker: ROBIN
words: But I saw you push the women and children out of the way in a mad panic! I saw you knock them down! And when you ran out, you left everyone behind!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Seemingly. Seemingly, to the untrained eye, I can fully understand how you got that impression. What looked like pushing...what looked like knocking down...was a safety precaution! In a fire, you stay close to the ground, am I right? And when I ran out that door, I was not leaving anyone behind! Oh, quite the contrary! I risked my life making sure that exit was clear. Any other questions?

speaker: FIREMAN
words: How do you live with yourself?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Its not easy.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So she doesn't want to see me anymore.

speaker: JERRY
words: Did you knock her over too, or just the kids?

speaker: GEORGE
words: No, her too. And her mother.

speaker: JERRY
words: Really? Her mother.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yeah. I may have stepped on her arm, too, I don't know.

speaker: JERRY
words: You probably couldn't see because of the smoke.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yeah. But it was somebody's arm.

speaker: JERRY
words: So you feel "women and children first," in this day and age, is somewhat of an antiquated notion.

speaker: GEORGE
words: To some degree.

speaker: JERRY
words: So basically, it's every man, woman, child, and invalid for themselves.

speaker: GEORGE
words: In a manner of speaking.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, it's honest.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yeah. She should be commending me for treating everyone like equals.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, perhaps when she's released from the burn center, she'll see things differently.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Perhaps.

speaker: JERRY
words: So, what was the fire? Just a couple of greasy hamburgers?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yeah. Eric the Clown put it out with his big shoe.

speaker: JERRY
words: By the way, did you see this? (Hands George a magazine)

speaker: GEORGE
words: What's that?

speaker: JERRY
words: It's the Leonard Christian article about my show. Plus my gig in Miami got cancelled, I betcha it's because of the article.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Wow, he really does a number on you. (reads) "Seinfeld froze like a deer in the headlights in the face of incessant heckling."

speaker: JERRY
words: I should have let her have it! I held back because of Kramer.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You know what you oughta do. You should go to her office and heckle her.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, right.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You know, like all the comedians always say, 'How would you like it if I came to where you work and heckled you?'

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, that'd be something.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm not kidding, you should do it.

speaker: JERRY
words: But wouldn't that be the ultimate comedian's revenge? I've always had a fantasy about doing that.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, go ahead! Do it!

speaker: JERRY
words: Why can't I?

speaker: GEORGE
words: No reason!

speaker: JERRY
words: You know what? I think I'm gonna do that! She came down to where I work, I'll go down to where she works!

speaker: GEORGE
words: This is unprecedented!

speaker: JERRY
words: There's no precedent, baby!

speaker: GEORGE
words: What...are you using my babies now?

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, nice shoes. What, you wear sandals to work? It's always nice to walk into a room and get the aroma of feet. That's real conducive to the work atmosphere. I'm sure your co-workers really appreciate it. 'Hey, let's go eat in Toby's office. Great idea! We can check on her bunions!'

speaker: TOBY
words: You know, I have work to do here! I'm very busy!

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, is this disruptive? You find it hard to work with someone...interrupting?

speaker: TOBY
words: Well, how would you like it if I called security?

speaker: JERRY
words: Security? Well, I don't know how you're gonna make it in this business if you can't take it! Ya gotta be tough! Booo! Boooo!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Wait a second, what's happenin' here? Toby! Toby!

speaker: KRAMER
words: What did you go up there to heckle her for?

speaker: JERRY
words: Because she came down to the club and heckled me! Give her a taste of her own medicine! (George enters.)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, YEAH! You gave her a taste of medicine, alright.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, I didn't want her to have an accident.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What accident?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, after he heckled Toby, she got so upset, she ran out of the building and a street sweeper ran over her foot and severed her pinky toe.

speaker: GEORGE
words: That's unbelievable!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah! Then after the ambulance left, I found the toe! So I put it in a Cracker Jack box, filled it with ice, and took off for the hospital.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You ran?

speaker: KRAMER
words: No, I jumped on the bus. I told the driver, "I got a toe here, buddy - step on it."

speaker: GEORGE
words: Holy cow!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah, yeah, then all of a sudden, this guy pulls out a gun. Well, I knew any delay is gonna cost her her pinky toe, so I got out of the seat and I started walking towards him. He says, "Where do you think you're going, Cracker Jack?" I said, "Well, I got a little prize for ya, buddy - " (Kramer throws two quick punches and a massive uppercut) - knocked him out cold!

speaker: GEORGE
words: How could you do that?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Then everybody is screamin,' because the driver, he's passed out from all the commotion...the bus is out of control! So, I grab him by the collar, I take him out of the seat, I get behind the wheel and now I'm drivin' the bus.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You're Batman.

speaker: KRAMER
