words: So, get this: Mister Peterman is finally letting me do some real writing. He's got this book deal, for his autobiography. He's gonna let me ghost write it.

speaker: JERRY
words: Wow. That's great! When it comes out, I'll have to get someone to ghost read it.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Hey!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Alright, so there I am at Lorenzo's - loading up my slice of the fixin's bar.. garlic, (imitates the shaking of garlic onto a pizza) and what-not.. mmm,

speaker: JERRY
words: The Van Buren Boys? There's a street gang named after President Martin Van Buren?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh yeah, and they're just as mean as he was! So, I make a move to the door, you know, (makes a noise) they block it! So, I lunged for the bathroom.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What? What happened?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Because I'm still holding the garlic shaker.. Yeah.. like this (grabs Jerry's peper shaker, and demonstrates) I'm only showing eight fingers.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, what does that mean?

speaker: KRAMER
words: That's their secret sign! See, Van Buren, he was teh eighth President.. (Holds up 8 fingers) They thought I was a former Van B. Boy!

speaker: ELLEN
words: (Sees a pay phone) Oh, Jerry, can you hold on a sec? I just want to check my messages.. (She meets up with two of her friends on the way to the phone)

speaker: MELISSA
words: Ellen.

speaker: ELLEN
words: Hey! You guys, I want you to meet Jerry. (Gestures tward Jerry, then goes back to the phone)

speaker: MELISSA
words: Ohh, we've heard a lot about you! (Confidentially) It is so sweet of you to take her out.

speaker: KIM
words: Yeah, you don't even know how much she needs this.

speaker: JERRY
words: (Sympathetically) She coming of a bad break-up?

speaker: KIM
words: (Casually) No.

speaker: MELISSA
words: See ya!

speaker: JERRY
words: Any messages?

speaker: ELLEN
words: Yeah, no one called.

speaker: JERRY
words: They act like it was some act of charity. Just going out with her.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So, she's the loser of the group. Every group has someone that they all make fun of.. Like us with Elaine. (Jerry thinks about this, then shakes it off)

speaker: JERRY
words: There is no way Ellen is the loser of that group.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Are you looking deep down at the real person underneath?

speaker: JERRY
words: No, I'm being as superficial as I possibly can!

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Changing subject) Hey, I htink I may have found someone for the scholarship.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm interviewing all these annoying little overachievers.. finally, this kid walks in - Steven Koren - a regular guy.. likes sports.. watches T.V..

speaker: JERRY
words: Is he smart?

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Defensively) He knows how to read. And he also knows finishing an entire book doesn't prove anything. And get this: he's into architecture.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey! Just like you pretend to be.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes. With a little guidance, Steven Koren is going to be everything I claim to be, only for real. That's my dream, Jerry.

speaker: JERRY
words: I had a dream last night that a hamburger was eating me!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Mister Peterman, thanks for having me over. Your place isn't quite what I imagined.. (It's plain, with no sign of Peterman's personality)

speaker: PETERMAN
words: Ohhh.. It's just a place to flop. (Sits in his recliner)

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well, (Clears throat) what part of your life (hits the record button on a mini-recorder, and sets it down on the table) do you want to start with? Foreign

speaker: PETERMAN
words: Oh, Elaine, we've covered all of that in the catalogue ad nauseum. No, I would like this book to be about my day-to-day life.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh.

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Turns on the T.V, and starts flipping through the channels) Oh damn. They changed the cable stations again.. just when I finally memorized them.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well, Mister Peterman, do you want to, um..

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Still flipping through the channels) 2.. CBS..

speaker: ELAINE
words: get, um, started..

speaker: PETERMAN
words: 3.. I don't know what that is.. where's my damn preview channel?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (After observing Peterman's home life) Well, I - I got ta tell you, Mister Peterman.. I don't think I see a whole book here.

speaker: PETERMAN
words: well, I'm sure we'll come up with something. What do you say you and I order ourselves a pie? Do you like Lorenzo's?

speaker: ELAINE
words: You know, a friend of mine almost got beat up at that place by the Van Buren Boys?

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Interested) You don't say.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah. The only think that saved him is that he accidentally flashed their secret gang sign.

speaker: PETERMAN
words: Well, that's pretty exciting. (Pause) Let's put that in the book.

speaker: ELAINE
words: But, that didn't happen to you.

speaker: PETERMAN
words: So, we pay off your friend, and it becomes a Peterman.

speaker: ELAINE
words: No, I - I really don't think you can do that.

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Looking at his dying plant) Ohh, damn. I forgot to buy plant food again.. I'll bet I got a coupon for it. (Starts looking through a small coupon box)

speaker: ELAINE
words: You know what? Maybe I better talk to my friend.

speaker: JERRY
words: Is that the same outfit you were wearing yesterday?

speaker: ELLEN
words: No, this is brand new. Do you like it?

speaker: JERRY
words: Actually, yeah. (Pause) Wait a second! Is that the fork that fell on the floor?! (Dramatically) Are you using the fork that fell on the floor?!

speaker: ELLEN
words: (Laughs) No, Jerry, the waitress game be another one.

speaker: JERRY
words: I guess that's all right.

speaker: ELLEN
words: Is something wrong, Jerry?

speaker: JERRY
words: No, absolutely nothing. (They get up to leave) You're fantastic! (They meet up with Kramer and George on the way out) Hey guys!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey.

speaker: JERRY
words: (Gesturing to Ellen) Kramer, George, this is Ellen.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ladies and gentlemen, this (Opens the door, Steven is standing there) is Steven Koren. His G.P.A. is a solid 2.0! Right in that meaty part of the curve -

speaker: WYCK
words: George, the quailifications for this scholarship were suppose to be.. largely academic.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm sure we're all aware of the flaws and biases of standardized tests..

speaker: WYCK
words: These aren't standardized tests - these are his grades.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Besides, Steven Koren has the highest of aspirations. He wants to be (pauses for effect) an architect.

speaker: WYCK
words: Is that right?

speaker: STEVEN
words: Actually, maybe I could set my sights a little bit higher.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Laughs) Steven, nothing is higher than an architect.

speaker: STEVEN
words: I think I'd really like to be a city planner. (Sits down, addressing the entire foundation board) Why limit myself to just one building, when I can design a

speaker: WYCK
words: Well, that's a good point.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Mutters) No, it's not.

speaker: STEVEN
words: Well, isn't an architect just an art school drop-out with a tilty desk, and a big ruler? (Laughs - so do the board members)

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Irritated) It's called a T-square.

speaker: WYCK
words: You know, the stupidest guy in my fraternity became an architect - after he flunked out of dental school! (Everyone but George laughs) Contratulations,

speaker: STEVEN
words: Thank you.

speaker: WYCK
words: Susan would be proud of what you're doing.

speaker: STEVEN
words: Thank you.

speaker: KRAMER
words: And they made it their sign, because, Van Buren, our 8th President, was the man they most admired.

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Laughs) Kramer, my friend, that is one ripping good yarn.. (Hands Kramer a check)

speaker: KRAMER
words: You know, if you like that one, I got more.. what are you looking for? Romance? Comedy? Adventue? .. Erotica? (Clicks his tongue)

speaker: ELAINE
words: No, uh, Kramer. I don't think -

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Interrupting) How much would you take for the whole lot?

speaker: KRAMER
words: My whole lot?

speaker: PETERMAN
words: Name your price, man!

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Thinks) 1500 dollars.

speaker: PETERMAN
words: I'll give you half that.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Excited) Done!

speaker: PETERMAN
words: Kramer, my friend, (Gestures to Elaine) consider Elaine at your disposal.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Okay.. (To Elaine) Well, I, Uh.. I like to work in the evenings.. (Elaine slumps back, and covers her head in misfortune)

speaker: ELAINE
words: Would you please just get on with the stupid Bob Saccamano story?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, I'm on the phone with Bob, and I realize right then and there that I need to return this pair of pants. So, I'm off to the store.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What happened to Bob Saccamano?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, nothing. His part of the story is done. (Elaine covers her face with her hands - showing her difficulty coping with Kramer) So I'm waiting for the

speaker: ELAINE
words: Alright, well, now that's something..

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, I don't know if I lost track of time - or what, but the next think I knew..

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Adding) A train is bearing down on you?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: No, I slipped - and fell in the mud. Ruining the very pants I was about to return.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Reflects on the story) I don't understand.. you were wearing the pants you were returning?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, I guess I was..

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Still confused) What were you gonna wear on the way back?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Elaine, are you listening?! I didn't even get there! (Pauses) All right, next story..

speaker: ELAINE
words: Alright, I think I got enough for one day.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah, yeah, chew on that.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Mocking) Yeah, I'll chew on that.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, hey, listen, by the way - I'm hosting a little get-together tonight in honor of my little financial upturn..

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, thanks. I've got plans.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Elaine, you should be there to document it.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Putting on her coat) Oh, you're getting together with some of your jackass friends, and you want me to take notes?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah, but get there after nine. You know, give the poeple a chance to loosen up.

speaker: JERRY
words: So you're denying him the scholarship just because he wants to be a city planner?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I was betrayed! That kid was like a son to me. And if there's one person you should be able to hold down, it's your own flesh and blood. Like my

speaker: JERRY
words: You know, maybe philanthropy is not your field. (Phone rings, he answers it) Hello. Oh, Hi, Ellen. Yeah, I called the hotel.. we're all set for the weekend.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You're spending the weekend with Ellen?

speaker: JERRY
words: (To George, in a 'cha-ching!' motion) Vermont! (To Ellen) With any luck, they said we could stay an extra couple of days if we want to! (George is

speaker: GEORGE
words: (To Kramer) You want to start?

speaker: KRAMER
words: (To George) Uh, No, no, no.. you go ahead. I gotta get my thoughts together.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Jerry, this whole Ellen situation.. has gone far enough.

speaker: JERRY
words: What?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Adding) Jerry, she's a loser. (George points to Kramer - gesturing that he's right on target)

speaker: JERRY
words: Where is this coming from? She's great!

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Concerned) Why're you doing this, Jerry? Is it your career? Things will pick up.

speaker: JERRY
words: There's nothing wrong with my career!

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Like a parent) Well, I still like the Bloomingdale's executive training program for him.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I though we said we weren't going to discuss that now!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, you know, I think it's something he should consider.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Of course he should consider it, but now is not the time!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Listen, George, all these issues are interrelated.

speaker: JERRY
words: (Fed up) Alright! Excuse me! (Gets up) I'm not buying any of this!

speaker: KRAMER
words: All right, so what're you saying? That we're wrong? Oh, everybody's wrong but you!

speaker: JERRY
words: You know, this is liek that Twilight Zone where the guy wakes up, and he's the same - but everyone else is different!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Which one?

speaker: JERRY
words: They were all like that!

speaker: STEVEN
words: Why'd you take away my scholarship, Mister Costanza?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, Steven, I, uh.. (All the sudden, a small gang steps out of nowhere, surrounding George)

speaker: STEVEN
words: These are my new friends - The Van Buren Boys.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh.. nice.

speaker: STEVEN
words: I want my scholarship back, so I can be a city planner.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What about architect, Steven?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah, well, you got that straight! (Turns to Elaine) Hey, Elaine, try the beef - because that's realy au jus sauce, huh. (Dramatically) Real au jus sauce!

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Sourly) I'll make a note of it.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ohh kay! Well, you know, I had Bob Saccamano on the phone, and I suddenly realized that I- (Elaine stops him)

speaker: ELAINE
words: You can't tell that story now. It belongs to Peterman.

speaker: KRAMER
words: What do ya mean?

speaker: ELAINE
words: You signed the release.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah.

speaker: ELAINE
words: He sat in mud. Not you.

speaker: KRAMER
words: But I did sit in mud.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Stern) Ya didn't! You never sat in mud!

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Pleading) I was all dirty!

speaker: ELAINE
words: It ever happened! Understand?

speaker: KRAMER
words: (To crowd) Hey, hey, hey! All right! Yeah, uh, yeah.. well.. Uh, the pants. they, uh, they fit, uh, well - and so I, uh, decided I wasn't gonna return them!

speaker: KRAMER
words: What? You're gonna go now? Hey, woah! I don't.. (watches his friends leave)

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Frantic) Kramer, Kramer! I got big trouble with the - with the Van Buren Boys.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, now, they're tough cookies.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yeah, and I - I heard you got on their good side. Now, what'd you do?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Uh.. ah, (Looks over at Elaine, and realizes he can't tell the Van Buren Boys story) Oh, nothing - nothing.. No, I certainly don't have any stories, if that's

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Frantic) Kramer, do you know what those guys are gonna do to me?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah, well, uh.. you know uh, you didn't hear from me, but, uh, the Van Buren Boys - they never hassle their own kind.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You mean, like, a former member?

speaker: ELAINE
words: These Kramer stories are unusable! (Thumbs through them) I mean, some of them aren't even stories! (Holds one out) Look, this is a list of things in his

speaker: JERRY
words: Is my toaster oven on there?

speaker: ELAINE
words: How am I ever gonna turn this into a book?

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, just shape them - change them. You're a writer.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yes! I'm a writer.

speaker: JERRY
words: Make them interesting.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Interesting! Of course! People love interesting writing!

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, I gotta go to the airport. I'm picking up my parents.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What? Wheren't they just here?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah. I'm flying them in to meet Ellen. I don't know where to turn! I gotta see what they think of her.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Maybe we could all have dinner later?

speaker: JERRY
words: I don't think so. I'm gonna try to get them to fly right back tonight.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, hey! Hey, have I told you about my bunions? Oh, you're gonna love this story! (Rubs his hands together) So, I line up my cold cuts on the couch

speaker: JERRY
words: Kramer, this is awful! We don't want to hear about this!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Damn!

speaker: JERRY
words: What?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, I bought a bunch of bunion stories from Newman - but they all stink!

speaker: ELAINE
words: How much did you pay for them?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Eight bucks! I think I got ripped off! (Leaves, yelling out "Newman!")

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, what didn't you like about the first chapter?

speaker: PETERMAN
words: Well, it started out nicely: "I'm returning some pants." A very identifiable problem.. (turns page) "I set of down a train tunnel.".. (turns page) But that's

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, no, no! That's where it gets interesting! Don't you see? The - the train is bearing down on you, you - you dive into a side tunnel - and you run into a

speaker: PETERMAN
words: It just seems so cliched, and obvious. It's not interesting writing.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah.. yeah. I know. Um.. how about if, instead of.. diving from the train, you.. uh, you, I don't know, you slip and, and fall in some mud, and.. ruin your

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Intrigued) The very pants I was returning. That's perfect irony! Elaine, that is interesting writing! (The intercom beeps)

speaker: SECRETARY
words: I have a Cosmo Kramer on line 4.

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Picks up the phone) Peterman, here.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Mister Peterson, you gotta sell me my stories back!

speaker: PETERMAN
words: You want to know something? I no longer need them!

speaker: ELAINE
words: No, no. Mister Peterman, why don't we keep them - as a, as a reference?

speaker: PETERMAN
words: Nonsense! (To Kramer) I have Benes' woderfully imaginative mind to spin my stories. You take back your tales, you vagabond!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yippie-yi-yay!

speaker: PETERMAN
words: (Hangs up) There you are, Elaine. Go forth, and create. (Elaine gets up to leave) And, by the way, when you get to that chapter about my romantic

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey, Van B. Boys.

speaker: STEVEN
words: So, Mister Costanza, did you get my scholarship back?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Now, fellas, fellas.. easy. You wouldn't want to beat up on one of your own.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Right.. the sign. (Hesitates, then makes a series of stupid gestures)

speaker: STEVEN
words: That's not the sign.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Defensively loud) It was when I was banging!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Love to! (Cracks his knuckles, then winces under the pain)

speaker: ELLEN
words: And after college, I got my masters at the Sorbonne.

speaker: MORTY
words: Sorbonne? Oh, hey. (To Helen) That's in Paris.

speaker: ELLEN
words: (Looks at her watch) Oh, Jerry, you're parking meter's about to expire. Don't get up, I've got change. (Leaves with her purse)

speaker: JERRY
words: (To his parents) So? What do you think?

speaker: HELEN
words: Jerry, she's fantastic.

speaker: JERRY
words: I knew it! I'm not crazy.

speaker: HELEN
words: She's so sweet, and she's got some body on her!

speaker: MORTY
words: And smart! Like a computer!

speaker: HELEN
words: And so much personality! But, it doesn't matter what we think. Do you like her?

speaker: JERRY
words: (After seeing how much his parents like her) Now, I'm not so sure.

speaker: HELEN
words: Well, she's 10 times better than that awful Amber girl that you were with.

speaker: JERRY
words: yeah, Amber.. I wonder if she's back from Vegas..

speaker: GEORGE
words: Alright, alright! (Goes out onto the sidewalk. The Seinfelds walk by) Seinfelds!

speaker: MORTY
words: Hey, George!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Shhh! Listen, you gotta do me a favor. Give me your wallet. I'll give it back to you later.

speaker: MORTY
words: How're your folks?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Eh, they're trying to pick out a new couch - you don't want to know. (Remembering the watching Van Buren Boys) Give me your wallet, or I'll spill your

speaker: MORTY
words: What did you say?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Come on, hurry up, old man! I'm an animal!

speaker: HELEN
words: You're being very rude. Come on, Morty.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Pleading) Please, please, they're gonna hit me! (Attempts to grab Helen's purse, she starts hitting George defensively, he backs off)

speaker: MORTY
words: Tell your parents we said 'Hi!' (They leave)

speaker: THE END
words: THE END

speaker: KRAMER
words: Look how dark it's gettin' already.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, it's not Daylight Savings Time yet.

speaker: KRAMER
words: When does it start?

speaker: JERRY
words: [pause] I don't know, they just tell you the night before.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Uh. Well, I'm sick o' waiting. [pulls out his pocket-watch (it has a chain, too)]

speaker: JERRY
words: [under breath] Oh, I'm sure that won't cause any problems..

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, god, it's Mike Moffit..

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh now, don't tell me you're still mad at him for calling you a phony. Jerry, that was five years ago!

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm not a phony an' I don't want anything to do with this guy.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey! Mike!

speaker: MIKE
words: [sees and is enthused, coming over] Kramer! Jerry! How's it goin'?!

speaker: JERRY
words: Fine. An' I'm not just sayin' that..

speaker: MIKE
words: Guess what? I just started my own business. I'm a bookie!

speaker: JERRY
words: No openings in arson?

speaker: MIKE
words: [pauses, struck by J's attitude] Either of you guys wanna place a bet: I'm your guy.

speaker: KRAMER
words: [quickly] Ah no no no. No bets for me, I uh, I got a disease.

speaker: JERRY
words: I'm feelin' a bit queasy myself. Maybe I'll see you in another five years. [casually leaves]

speaker: MIKE
words: Kramer. Jerry still mad about that "phony" thing?

speaker: KRAMER
words: You kidding? It's all water near a bridge.

speaker: MIKE
words: Hey, what time you got?

speaker: KRAMER
words: [pulling out his timepiece] Oh yes. Uh.. it's aaalmost six.

speaker: MIKE
words: Whoa--uh--I'm really late. [leaves]

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh! These designs look great! Peggy, you really saved me.

speaker: PEGGY
words: Oh, it was no problem.

speaker: ELAINE
words: [leaving with the drawings] Mr. Peterman is gonna love 'em.

speaker: PEGGY
words: [focusing on her work] Thanks, Susie.

speaker: ELAINE
words: You won't believe this but, as I'm leaving, she calls me "Susie."

speaker: JERRY
words: I don't see you as a Susie. Sharon maybe.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What am I, a--a bulimic, chain-smoking, stenographer from Staten Island?

speaker: JERRY
words: Who are you describing?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Someone I know.

speaker: JERRY
words: Named Sharon?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I'd rather not say.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey.

speaker: ELAINE
words: [to say hello] Mmm!

speaker: GEORGE
words: [sitting] Newww tuxedo. For the Pinstripe Ball. Steinbrenner is throwing a huge party at Tavern on the Green, heh!

speaker: JERRY
words: Kind of a Yankee prom?

speaker: GEORGE
words: [resentfully dampened] It's not a prom. It's a Ball.

speaker: JERRY
words: You taking Allison?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes, of course I'm taking Allison. This woman is genetically engineered to go to a ball. Tall, blonde, lithe--

speaker: JERRY
words: Live?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Lithe.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Live?

speaker: ELAINE
words: [rolling her eyes] Lithe!

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, lithe!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Well, you two'll have a great time there.

speaker: JERRY
words: It can't be worse than this.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Mmm!

speaker: GEORGE
words: An' wait'll you see the dress that she's got. It's backless! Uh?! I'm finally gonna make a Great Entrance!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Backless? Ya gonna back her in?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Elaine, when a woman makes a Ball Entrance.. she twirls.

speaker: ELAINE
words: She's not gonna twirl--

speaker: GEORGE
words: She'll Twirl.

speaker: GEORGE
words: That is what Mr. Steinbrenner wants. He wants, everyone, ta, twirl around.

speaker: ALLISON

words: Did you dressed nice, did you do it classy?

words: Yeah, I started out real classy...

words: Yeah you did, you classed it up!

words: Oh, so it backfired?

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So, I guess I was lucky that I never tried that myself.

words: Of course she treats skin cancer. That's how I met her, she was doing a skin cancer screening at Peterman. That's what dermatologists do.

speaker: JERRY
words: Sadly, that knowledge could've help me.

words: Wait a minute, she did a skin cancer screening at Peterman?

words: Aha.

words: Could she do that at Kruger?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I don't know, I guess.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So I set up a screening, everyone takes their shirt off and click, I snap me a shot of a bear-chested Kruger.

speaker: ELAINE
words: You have a little thing for this fella'?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Jerry, you gotta talk to Sitarides.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yesterday you said I had to get my revenge on her!

speaker: GEORGE
words: And that was wrong, Jerry! You simple must to apologize..

speaker: JERRY
words: Must I?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yes! Because it is the mature, adult thing to do.

speaker: JERRY
words: How does that reflect me?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Elaine, alright where's the SP2000? Cause I gotta slice.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Aah, I forgot it. I gotta get home.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ok, I'll go with you.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Umm, I'm not actually going straight to home, I have to first stop at the eh...circus, you know with all the...clowns.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, well you have fun...(Elaine leaves) oh no clowns...hate clowns...the clowns.

speaker: JERRY
words: So again, I'm sorry. I had no right to yell at you, you're a life saving doctor and I'm just a comedian...

speaker: SARA
words: Jerry, enough. I'll do your friend's cancer screening, because I believe in that, but as far as you and I are concerned; it's off.

speaker: JERRY
words: Was it pimple popper MD?

speaker: SARA
words: That's the one. (Taps Jerry on the cheek and leaves.)

speaker: JERRY
words: Still got it.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Out, damn heal!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Elaine?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Kramer?

words: Yeah listen, I need my slicer back.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Just hold on!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey, what's going on?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Nothing...(heal comes loose and Elaine opens the door.) Here, ok I'm on the phone alright? I'm on the phone with someone...

speaker: KRAMER
words: My blade is all dinged up. Oh, come on! Elaine!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Phone call! I'm in a big phone call!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Come on, this is important! (Shakes the door handle and it comes loose. Kramer falls backwards to the next door.)

speaker: NEIGHBOR
words: Hey, get the hell out of here!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Wow, that's a lot of potatoes.

speaker: KRAMER
words: So, George took my slicer down to Kruger and they're smoothing it out for me.

speaker: JERRY
words: What the hell is this?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Boy, that looks like an allergic reaction. Have you been wearing a fake beard?

speaker: JERRY
words: No.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, what have you been doing?

speaker: JERRY
words: Nothing, I got up, run some errands, I went down to Sara's office and apologized...

speaker: KRAMER
words: Whoa whoa, backup, Dr. Sitarides, what happened there?

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, I tried to apologise, it didn't go over that well...

speaker: KRAMER
words: There, there's your hives.

speaker: JERRY
words: What, she gave me hives?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Jerry, as the Bible says; Thou who cureth, can maketh ill.

speaker: JERRY
words: She did kind of touch my face.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Now you listen to me, you've got to find this woman and tell her that you're not a test tube pin cushion.

speaker: JERRY
words: It does itch. Maybe I will go down at Kruger and talk to her.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Alright, great, because I got to get down there and pick up my blade. Hey, and I couldn't find that stock room.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, that's fantastic.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I just talked to Mr. Kruger, he'll be down in a minute. He wanted me to take a photograph for the record.

words: What record?

speaker: GEORGE
words: His personal file, I, I don't ask...

speaker: SARA
words: Jerry? What brings you here?

speaker: JERRY
words: I don't know, this? (Shows his neck to Sara.)

speaker: SARA
words: Looks like hives.

speaker: JERRY
words: Where do you suppose that could've come from?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Jerry, what are you doing...

speaker: KRAMER
words: He is just setting the record straight.

speaker: JERRY
words: Come on Sitarides, cop to it. What brand of perverted science do you practice?

speaker: SARA
words: Are you suggesting I somehow I infected you on purpose?

speaker: JERRY
words: I want the antidote, pimple popper!

speaker: SARA
words: That's it, I'm out of here! You're insane.

speaker: JERRY
words: Am I? You touched my face. I didn't imagine that!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Dr. Sitarides don't go! Oh, thanks Jerry!

speaker: KRUGER
words: Hey George, hey Doc. We doing the screening here?

words: Aah, yeah, yeah. Won't you head on in, we'll be in in a second. Be right with you.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Doc, huh?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Kramer, this is perfect. I need you to go in there, pretend you're a doctor and check this guy for moles.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Moles, yes. Freckle's ugly cousin.

speaker: GEORGE
words: And get a picture of him, with his shirt off.

speaker: KRAMER
words: You really are cooking up a little scheme here, aren't you?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Alright, lets get in there. Quick, quick, quick...

speaker: ELAINE
words: This is it. I can take this anymore.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Male mammal. Approximately 30 to 60 years of age. Weight...uh indeterminate. Ok, Mr. Kruger, we are gonna take a photo now for the records. So if you'll stand up please and give me a big smile, oh no no no, not that big. Yeah, that's nice, yes okay. Yes, let's have a looksee...ok, so eh, fiber from shirt on the left shoulder. I'm gonna have to keep my on that.

speaker: KRUGER
words: How long have you been doing this Dr. Van Nostrand?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Uuh, long long time. Yes, I've seen moles so big they have their own moles. Freckles that cover two men.

speaker: KRUGER
words: So, how am I looking?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, so far, so good...(looks at Mr. Kruger's shoulder) yeuye...

speaker: GEORGE
words: Kramer, I really owe you one.

speaker: KRAMER
words: George, we got a problem.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, he's got a mole on his shoulder. Very suspicious.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So, tell him you're concerned about it and he should see someone else.

speaker: KRAMER
words: George, why would I, a Juilliard trained dermatologist, send him to another doctor?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Because, you're not a dermatologist.

speaker: KRAMER
words: He thinks I am. I'm not gonna betray that trust. Here's what I wanna do; I think I can get a section...

speaker: GEORGE
words: Whoa, whoa, a section?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah, if I could crab my slicer and he'd hold still...

speaker: GEORGE
words: No, you're not taking a deli slicer to my boss...

speaker: KRAMER
words: It'll be operative thing, he would barely feel it.

speaker: GEORGE
words: No! Absolutely Not!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, it's my medical opinion, that you're making a big mistake. And it's going in my chart.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, hello is this Allied Lock Smith?! Oh, finally, listen I need someone to come over here right away!

speaker: NEIGHBOR
words: Turn it off! Turn it off!

speaker: ELAINE
words: I am getting a lock smith, alright?! Relax!

speaker: NEIGHBOR
words: Alright, that's it!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah, the address is 78th West...

speaker: NEIGHBOR
words: Oh, oh mama...

speaker: JERRY
words: So, Kramer pulled it off?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yep, and the photo was all fixed and back on his desk, no thanks to you.

speaker: JERRY
words: Well, that woman had it coming to her. Look at my neck, it looks like I had a beard of bees!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Why don't you see someone about it?

speaker: JERRY
words: I've called everyone. You know how hard it is to get a dermatologist in this town? (Kramer comes in) A real dermatologist.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Points to a page on the book) Squamous cell carcinoma.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You're not a doctor. You shouldn't even have books like this.

speaker: KRAMER
words: George, that's what he has and I have to give him a call. Now we gotta came clean.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You can't tell him the truth, you're gonna blow the whole thing.

speaker: KRAMER
words: I don't want this on my conscience.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'll get him to see a real doctor. You just stay away from this.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah, alright...

words: Hey, I wonder if they have a picture of my rash in here.

speaker: KRAMER
words: They've got everything there, Jerry. I underlined the best parts.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, this looks like the thing I have. Caused by exposure to benzene, a common ingredient in metal cleaners.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, that's weird.

speaker: JERRY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, I'm cleaning my slicer.

speaker: JERRY
words: That's my hand towel! I use that on my face, hands and chest! That's where the hives are coming from! It's not from Dr. Sitarides, it's from Dr. Van Nostrand!

speaker: KRAMER
words: So, somehow the Bronzo (?) is reacting to the poison she's giving you.

speaker: JERRY
words: Alright, get out. And take your Bronzo with you (throws the bottle to Kramer.)

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ohh, that's toxic. (Jerry throws the towel over Kramer's head.) Ououou....

speaker: KRUGER
words: George, come in. I'm just going over our annual report...boy did we take it on the chin last year.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Eh, listen Mr. Kruger, I got a message from Dr. Van Nostrand and he says it might be wise to you to see another doctor about that mole.

speaker: KRUGER
words: I'm not too worried about it.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, he said it could be cancer, maybe you should get it checked out.

speaker: KRUGER
words: George, take a look at this photo. This is taken 10 years ago. That mole looks exactly as it does today. So, there's no cause for concern, eh?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Whatever.

speaker: KRUGER
words: Actually, funny thing about this photo. We were at the beach and there was this dumb looking guy near by. When he went in for a swim, my sons and I took all his stuff and threw it in the ocean! What a pear shaped loser.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, that pear shaped loser was me! And I was in that photo, until I broke in here, stole the photograph and airbrushed myself out of there!

speaker: KRUGER
words: Well, I'll be...you have lost a lot of hair.

speaker: GEORGE
words: That's what they tell me!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Do you want more pastrami?

words: Um, what was that last thing you gave me? That was pretty good.

words: Yeah, it was olive loaf. You want that?

words: I don't want to talk about it!

words: (Observing Elaine's bandaged nose) Well, what happened to your nose?

words: She.. was.

words: 'Till she found out Elaine slept with the groom.

words: (Interested) Ooohh.. That sounds juicy. Listen, I gotta go to the bathroom, but I want to hear all about it. (Gets up and heads for the bathroom)

words: (While skimming a Monk's menu) You know, I didn't go to the bathroom the entire time we were in India.

words: I can't believe we went all the way to India for a wedding!

words: That's it! The wedding's off.

words: What? But, Sue Ellen-

words: (Cutting him off. To Elaine) Elaine, you were my maid of honor and you slept with MY Pinter?!

words: No, no, no! It was years ago - before you met him. And, and I got to tell you.. it was very mechanical.

words: I have never been so humiliated!

words: (To Jerry and George) Idiots! This is all yoru fault!

words: (While pointing at Jerry) Not me! Him! His fault! He betrayed me!

speaker: JERRY
words: (Pleading) George, I'm sorry..

speaker: GEORGE
words: You can stuff your sorries in a sack, Mister!

speaker: JERRY
words: (Confused) I don't know what that means.

words: (To his girlfriend) Alright, Nina, you have to decide right now. Jerry or me?

words: (Casually) Alright.. Neither.

words: What?! Well, what are you doing here?

words: A free trip to India. And by the way, you can take off those boots. Everyone knows you're five' six.

words: Five' eight! Five' seven!

words: (To Sue Ellen) See? See the way they are?! We're - we're still best friends, right?

words: No. (Grabbing at the stud in Elaine's nose) And take that stupid thing out of your nose!

words: That's got to hurt, I don't care where you're from!

words: (Whispering to Jerry) What time is our flight back? I got to go to the bathroom.

words: (Whispering to Jerry) Hey.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What happened last night?

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, you were pretty loaded.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Gesturing to her nose stud) I know. I woke up with this.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh. Hello, Tetanus.

speaker: NINA
words: George, I've used the bathroom. It's fine.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Struggling) No, no, no, no. I can walk it off. It's a hundred and twenty degrees in here.. I'll sweat it out.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Seeing George, she walks over to greet him) Hey. (Looking at his shoes) Are those Timberlands painted black?

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Looking at her nose) Is your nose pierced?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Embarrassed) I should.. (Walks tward the bride and groom)

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yeah. (Points to two open seats in front of Jerry's. To Nina) Sit down there. (Sees Jerry in the crowd) Hello, Jerry. (Obviously angered at Jerry) I

words: (As George sits down) George, we need to talk.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Trying to keep his voice down) I think you've done a lot more than talk! You betrayed me!

speaker: JERRY
words: Alright, I admit it. I slept with Nina, but that's all.

words: (Outraged) "That's all"?! That's everything! I don't know what all the rest of it is for anyway!

speaker: JERRY
words: (Pleading) I'm really sorry.

speaker: GEORGE
words: You can stuff your sorries in a sack, mister!

words: (Confused) Where'd you get that one?

words: It's an expression.

words: (From the front of the room, she can hear George and Jerry's heated discussion) Hey! Shhhhh! (Crosses herself, then shakes her head - apologizing)

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Trying to whisper to Jerry) Look, we are gonna settle this right now! I demand reparations! I should get to sleep with Elaine. That's the only way to

speaker: JERRY
words: That doesn't punish me. It punishes Elaine! And cruelly, I might add.

words: (Losing it) Funny guy!

words: Hey! Monkeys! Knock it off. My best friend is trying to get married up here!

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Definite) I'm not gonna sleep with you.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Reparations!

words: Would you grow up, George?! What is the difference? Nina slept with (Points to Jerry) him, he slept with me, I slept with Pinter. Nobody cares! It's all

words: (Loud, so everyone at the wedding can hear) You slept with the groom?!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, thank you, FDR!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Alright, FDR.. This wish is for all the marbles. You win, you get your wish - I drop dead. I win, I don't drop dead, and I get one-hundred percent

words: Alright.

words: Oh, man! Well, then, come on. There's got to be something that'll change your mind, FDR. Something.." (FDR lifts up a cooler, and puts it on the table)

words: How did he find out?

words: You know you're not supposed to drink whil you're keeping a secret! (Elaine laughs) Is there anything else?

speaker: ELAINE
words: I can't tell you.

speaker: JERRY

speaker: ELAINE
words: Okay. (Takes a drink) I slept with the groom.

speaker: JERRY
words: Pinter?

words: He used to be called Peter.

speaker: JERRY
words: (Making nothing of it) So? Who cares about that?

speaker: ELAIEN
words: Sue Ellen! If she knew, she'd call off the whole wedding.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, nobody's calling off any weddings. (Elaine, at this point, has climbed onto the couch and is squirming around - she now has her backside to Jerry)

speaker: ELAINE
words: Do you know what 'Jerry' is in Indian?

speaker: JERRY
words: (Carrying her out, piggy-back style) No, what?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Between laughs) Jugdish.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yes, jugdish.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (While sliding off Jerry onto the hallway floor) Hey, what if I got my nose pierced? That would be pretty freaky.. Oooohhhhaaa!

speaker: JERRY
words: (Trying to get rid of her) Yes, I think it's a fine idea. Well, good night. (Shuts the door)

words: (Sticking her fingers through the blinds - waving at him) G'night, Jugdish. (Laughs)

speaker: JERRY
words: Bless you.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Thank you..

words: Well, guess what, FDR? I made a wish on a shooting star last night, and I wished against your wish.

words: That's funny. As it happens, I saw the same shooting star and double-wished you to drop dead. (Hands Kramer some coins) Here's your change.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Alright, I'm triple-wishing! Yep!

speaker: FDR
words: (Throwing four coins into the fountain) Then I'm quadruple-wishing!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Alright.. (Pulls out one of his eyebrows) How do you like this? (Blows it away) Ya!

speaker: FDR
words: I like it a lot. (Pulls out one of his eyebrows) Ow! (Blows it away)

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Tears out another eyelash) Ah! (Blows it away)

speaker: FDR
words: (Doing the same) Oh! (Blows it away)

words: Oh, God, it's so hot! (Sniffing) What's that smell?

speaker: JERRY
words: (Joking around) I think it's the stench of death.

speaker: NINA
words: George, you've been wearing those boots since I met you. You're not gonna wear them to the wedding, are you?

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Laughing nervously) No.. I'm gonna wear black shoes.

speaker: ELAIEN
words: (Sees her enemy, Sue Ellen, at the airport) Oh boy. There's Sue Ellen. She didn't want me at this wedding, but here I am with a buch of my idiot friends!

speaker: JERRY
words: (Giddy) This is gonna be great!

speaker: SUE ELLEN
words: (Walking up to the group) Elaine? Oh! Oh, I am so happy to see you!

words: (Confused by her reaction) You are?

words: Well, of course! No one else was even willing to come to India. I mean, not even Pinter's parents - and they're Indian.

words: Come on, Sue Ellen. You don't wear a bra, you're tall.. we hate each other!

speaker: SUE ELLEN
words: Elaine, I know. I know we've had our problems, but.. I want you to be my maid of honor - and my best friend.

words: (Toying with the idea) Huh.. alright. I guess.

speaker: SUE ELLEN
words: Uh, this is my fiance, Pinter. (To Pinter) Say hello.

speaker: PINTER
words: (Walking up to them) Hello.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Recognizing him) Peter?

speaker: SUE ELLEN
words: Uh, no. It's Pinter. Does anyone want to use the bathroom?

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Leading Nina out the airport) Oh, no. No. We're good. Let's get goin'. Alright. (Almost bumps into Jerry) Watch it, funny man. (Leaves)

words: Elaine, have you noticed George was acting strage the whole flight?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Acting equilly strange) No. What? Like what? What? Strange.. No. I..

speaker: JERRY
words: (Pulls a small bottle out of his pocket) Uh-huh. Hey, look what they had on the plane. Schnapps.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Ooohh.

speaker: KRAME
words: Come on.. Come on. Yes! (Sees a falling star) There's one! (Yelling out) I wish I don't drop dead!!

words: (Off-screen) Hey, shut up up there!

speaker: KRAMER
words: You shut up!

speaker: MAN
words: Aw, drop dead!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hello, friend. Enjoying the flight?

speaker: JERRY
words: Coach to India - The only way to go.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Heavily sarcastic. He's angered at Jerry) Good one. Very funny. You're very funny, Jerry. That's what I always tell people. (Yelling out) Jerry Seinfeld's

speaker: JERRY
words: You all right?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Of course I'm all right. I'm here with my girl. Nina. And what better way to pass the time than gabbing with my best friend.. with whom there are no

speaker: JERRY
words: (Joking around) Hey, didn't I beat you up in the fourth grade?

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Yelling out to the whole coach) Funny guy! (Points to Jerry) Right here!

speaker: NINA
words: By the way, you never said anything to George about Jerry and me, did ya?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh please.. It's in the vault.

speaker: GEORGE

words: (Interrupting) Scab! Scab! (pointing at Elaine) Scab!

speaker: GWEN
words: Hey.

speaker: JERRY
words: Boy, am I glad to see you.

speaker: GWEN
words: You were expecting someone else?

speaker: JERRY
words: You never know.

speaker: GWEN
words: (To driver) You know, you might want to take the tunnel.

speaker: JERRY
words: So, uh, what do you feel like eating? Chinese or Italian?

speaker: GWEN
words: I can go either way.

speaker: JERRY
words: (Shocked) You're telling me.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So, she was switching? Back and forth?

speaker: JERRY
words: Actually, the only place she always looked good was in that back booth over there.

speaker: GEORGE
words: So, just bring her here. This is all you really need.

speaker: JERRY
words: I can't just keep bringing her to the coffee shop. I mean, what if things, you know, progress?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Lights out.

speaker: JERRY
words: Alright, I'll give it a shot! I do really like this coffee shop. Nice cuff links, by the way.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Pointing to them) Office Christmas gift. I tell you, this Human Fund is a gold mine!

speaker: JERRY
words: That's not a french cuff shirt, you know.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I know. I cut the button off and poked a hole with a letter opener.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh, that's classy.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, Happy Festivus.

speaker: GEORGE
words: What is that? Is taht the pole?!

speaker: FRANK
words: George, Festivus is your heritage - it's part of who you are.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Sulking) That's why I hate it.

speaker: KRAMER
words: There's a big dinner Tuesday night at Frank's house - everyone's invited.

speaker: FRANK
words: George, you're forgetting how much Festivus has meant to us all. I brought one of the casette tapes. (Franks pushes play, George as a child celebrating

speaker: FRANK
words: Read that poem.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Complaining) I can't read it. I need my glasses!

speaker: FRANK
words: You don't need glasses, you're just weak! You're weak!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Leave him alone!

speaker: FRANK
words: Alright, George. It's time for the feats of strength.

speaker: GEORGE
words: No! No! Turn it off! No feats of strength! (Gets up and starts running out of the coffee shop) I hate Festivus!

speaker: FRANK
words: We had some good times.

speaker: GWEN
words: Hey.

speaker: JERRY
words: I there. This is Kramer, and Frank.

speaker: GWEN
words: Hi.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Shocked at her ugliness, he stammers) Hello.

speaker: GWEN
words: So, you ready to go?

speaker: JERRY
words: Uh, why don't we stay here? The back booth just opened up. (They both walk to the booth and sit down. Suddenly, Gwen is attractive) Now this is a good

speaker: KRAMER
words: Protect Festivus! Hey, no bagels, no bagels, no bagels, (Continues to chant)

speaker: MANAGER
words: (To a waiting Elaine) Lady, if you want a sandwich, I'll make you a sandwich.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Whining) I want the one that I earned. (Phone rings) I'll get it. I'll get it! (Into phone) H&H, and Elaine.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (From a phone booth right outside the store) Elaine, you should get out of there. I sabotaged the bagel machine last night. It's going down.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What did you do?

speaker: KRAMER
words: You've been warned.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, hi! (Waves at him)

speaker: WORKER
words: Hey, the steam valve's broke.

speaker: MANAGER
words: Can we still make bagels?

speaker: WORKER
words: Sure. It's just a little steamy.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey! How do you like your bagels now?!

speaker: KRUGER
words: George, I got something for you. (Pulls a check from his pocket) I'm suppose to find a charity and throw some of the company's money at it. They all

speaker: GEORGE
words: 20 thousand dollars?

speaker: KRUGER
words: Made out to the Human Fund. (Tries to enter his office, but it's locked) Oh, damn. I've locked myself out of my office again. Oh well. I'm going home.

speaker: GWEN
words: Jerry, how many times do we have to come to this.. place?

speaker: JERRY
words: Why? It's our place.

speaker: GWEN
words: I just found a rubber band in my soup.

speaker: JERRY
words: Oh.. I know who's cooking today!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Hey! Surprise, surprise!

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey, Georgie!

speaker: GWEN
words: I think I'm just gonna go.

speaker: JERRY
words: I'll be here.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Sees Gwen's meal) Hey, soup.

speaker: JERRY
words: She didn't touch it.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ohh.. Paco! (Flicks rubber band tward the kitchen) Hey, take a look at this. (Hands Jerry Kruger's check)

speaker: JERRY
words: 20 thousand dollars from Kruger? You're not keeping this.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I don't know.

speaker: JERRY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I've been doing a lot of thinking. This might be my chance to start giving something back.

speaker: JERRY
words: You want to give something back? Start with the 20 thousand dollars.

speaker: GEORGE
words: I'm serious.

speaker: JERRY
words: You're going to start your own charity?

speaker: GEORGE
words: I think I could be a philanthropist. a kick ass philanthropist! I would have all this money, and people would love me. Then they would come to me.. and

speaker: ELAINE
words: Kramer, the vest just called.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Shocked by the way Elaine looks) Yama - Hama! It's fright night!

speaker: ELAINE
words: Oh, yeah, I got a little steam bath. Listen, in 10 minutes, I'm gonna have my hands on that "Atomic Sub" card.

speaker: KRAMER
words: And?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Embarrassed) Free sub. (Starts to leave) I'll see ya.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Yeah.

speaker: GWEN
words: Kramer, Hi!

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, hello.

speaker: GWEN
words: It's Gwen.. We met .. at the coffee shop.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ah-huh.

speaker: GWEN
words: I'm dating your friend, Jerry..

speaker: KRAMER
words: Ahh.. I don't know who you really are, but I've seen Jerry's girlfriend, and she's not you. You're much better looking - and like, a foot taller.

speaker: GWEN
words: That's why we're always hiding in that coffee shop! He's afraid of getting caught.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, he's a tomcat.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Steve.

speaker: DENIM VEST
words: Hmm?

speaker: ELAINE
words: It's Elaine.

speaker: DENIM VEST
words: From Tim Whatley's party?

speaker: ELAINE
words: Yeah.

speaker: DENIM VEST
words: You look.. different.

speaker: ELAINE
words: I see you're still sticking with the denim. (He's wearing a denim coat) Do you have that card that I gave you?

speaker: DENIM VEST
words: Well, I had it back at my place, but I can't go there now.. I'll give it to you later, or something.

speaker: ELAINE
words: No, no, no. You give me your number.

speaker: DENIM VEST
words: Okay. Sure. (Pulls out a pad, and starts writing a number down) Do you have the mumps?

speaker: ELAINE
words: No.

speaker: DENIM VEST
words: Typhoid?

speaker: ELAINE
words: No.

speaker: DENIM VEST
words: (Hands her the paper, and runs off) Yama - Hama!

speaker: ELAINE
words: A fake number! Blimey!

speaker: KRUGER
words: George, we have a problem. There's a memo, here, from accounting telling me there's no such thing as the Human Fund.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, there could be.

speaker: KRUGER
words: But there isn't.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, I - I could, Uh, I could give the money back. Here. (Holds it out)

speaker: KRUGER
words: George, I don't get it. If there's no Human Fund, those donation cards were fake. You better have a damn good reason why you gave me a fake

speaker: GEORGE
words: Well, sir, I - I gave out the fake card, because, um, I don't really celebrate Christmas. I, um, I celebrate Festivus.

speaker: KRUGER
words: Vemonous?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Festivus, Sir. And, uh, I was afraid that I would be persecuted for my beliefs. They drove my family out of Bayside, Sir!

speaker: KRUGER
words: Are you making all this up, too?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh, no, Sir. Festivus is all too real. And.. I could prove it - if I had to.

speaker: KRUGER
words: Yeah, you probably should.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Happy Festivus!

speaker: FRANK
words: George? This is a surprise. (Looking at Kruger) Who's the suit?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Yo, dad. This is my boss, Mr. Kruger.

speaker: FRANK
words: Have you seen the pole, Kruger?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Dad, he doesn't need to see the pole.

speaker: FRANK
words: He's gonna see it.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Happy Festivus! (Sees Elaine) Yama - Hama!

speaker: ELAINE
words: I didn't have time to go home. What are you doing here?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Embracing my roots.

speaker: JERRY
words: They nailed you on the 20 G's?

speaker: GEORGE
words: Busted cold.

speaker: FRANK
words: It's made from aluminum. Very high strength-to-weight ratio.

speaker: KRUGER
words: I find your belief system fascinating.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Hey! Happy Festivus, everyone! (Hugs George, and jumps up and down) Hee, hee, hee!

speaker: BOOKIE
words: Hello again, Miss Benes.

speaker: ELAINE
words: What are you doing here?

words: Damnedest thing.. me and Charlie were calling to ask you out, and, uh, we got this bagel place..

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Finishing the story) I told them I was just about to see you.. It's a Festivus miracle!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: Dinner's ready!

speaker: FRANK
words: Let's begin.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Uh.. that's right.

speaker: FRANK
words: Welcome, new comers. The tradition of Festivus begins with the airing of grievances. I got a lot of problems with you people! And now you're gonna hear

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh, God.

speaker: FRANK
words: (To George) Quiet, you'll get yours in a minute. Kruger, you couldn't smooth a silk sheet if you had a hot date with a babe.. I lost my train of thought.

speaker: GWEN
words: Jerry!

speaker: JERRY
words: Gwen! How'd you know I was here?

speaker: GWEN
words: Kramer told me.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Another Festivus miracle!

speaker: GWEN
words: I guess this is the ugly girl I've been hearing about.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Hey, I was in a shvitz for 6 hours. Give me a break.

speaker: JERRY
words: Gwen. Gwen, wait! Ah! (runs back to his seat) Bad lighting on the porch.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (To bookie) Hey, how'd my horse do?

speaker: BOOKIE
words: He had to be shot.

speaker: FRANK
words: And now as Festivus rolls on, we come to the feats of strength.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Not the feats of strength..

speaker: FRANK
words: This year, the honor goes to Mr. Kramer.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Uh-oh. Oh, gee, Frank, I'm sorry. I gotta go. I have to work a double shift at H&H.

speaker: JERRY
words: I thought you were on strike?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Well, I caved. I mean, I really had to use their bathroom. Frank, no offence, but this holiday is a little (makes a series of noises) out there.

speaker: GEORGE
words: Kramer! You can't go! Who's gonna do the feats of strength?

speaker: KRUGER
words: (Sipping liquor from a flask) How about George?

speaker: FRANK
words: Good thinking, Kruger. Until you pin me, George, Festivus is not over!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh, please, somebody, stop this!

speaker: FRANK
words: (Taking off his sweater) Let's rumble!

speaker: ESTELLE
words: I think you can take him, Georgie!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Oh, come on! Be sensible.

speaker: FRANK
words: Stop crying, and fight your father!

speaker: GEORGE
words: Ow! .. Ow! I give, I give! Uncle!

speaker: FRANK
words: This is the best Festivus ever!

speaker: MANAGER
words: Alright. That's enough. You're fired.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Thank - you! (Gets his coat, and leaves)

speaker: THE END
words: THE END

speaker: GEORGE
words: When are they gonna have the flying cars, already?

words: Yeah, they have been promising that for a while..

words: Years. When we were kids, they made it seem like it was right around the corner.

words: I think Ed Begley Jr. has one.

words: No. That's just electric.

words: (Sarcastic) What's the competition, Chitty Chitty Bang Bang?

words: Well, what do you think the big holdup is?

words: The government is very touchy about us being in the air. Let us run around on the ground as much as we want. Anything in the air is a big production.

words: Yeah, right. And what about the floating cities?

speaker: GEORGE
words: And the underwater bubble cities?

words: It's like we're living in the '50s here.

words: I'm starving. We should have had lunch first..

speaker: JERRY
words: (Trying to quiet George down) It'll be twenty minutes. I told ya, Puddy's getting me an insider deal.

words: Since when is Elaine's boyfriend selling cars? I thought he was a mechanic.

speaker: JERRY
words: I guess he graduated.

speaker: GEORGE
words: That's an easy move: go from screwin' you behind your back to screwin' you right to your face.

speaker: JERRY
words: (To Kramer) Thank you.

speaker: GEORGE

words: Alright. Calm down.

words: (To Kramer) Alright, we're goin' in.

words: You've got a good eye, there. I see you've noticed the uni-body construction. I'm Rick. Are you looking to buy or lease?

words: Uh, borrow. It's for my friend. Yeah, he'll be buying..

words: Maybe I should talk to him.

speaker: KRAMER
words: Oh, I don't think so. No, he's an entertainer. You know, all over the place. That's where I come in.

words: I see. So, you're his manag-

words: Look at these salesmen. The only thing these guys fear is the walk-out. No matter what they say, you say, "I'll walk out of here right now!"

words: Can I help you with something?

words: (Threatening) Hold it! One more step and we're walkin'!

words: (Scolding) George. (To salesman) Sorry, we're just waiting for David Puddy.

words: (Still with a tone) He is. You don't know what I'm doin' here.

words: Hey.

speaker: JERRY
words: Hey.

words: Sorry I'm late.

words: (Full of pride) My new salesman boyfriend took me out to celebrate his promotion.

speaker: JERRY
words: Ah. Where'd you go?

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Obviously embarrassed) Uh, to a restaurant.

words: Arby's.

words: I had the roast beef..

words: So, Puddy, I decided I'm gonna go with another 900 convertible.

words: (Interrupting) David, can you tell me where the Xerox machine is?

words: Oh, sure, babe. Salesman-only copy room (Points) right there.

words: (Mocking, skeptic) Yeah, you show us the 900.

words: .. And look at these features, Mr. Kramer: Anti-lock breaks, automatic climate control. Uh, (Points out the windshield) make a right at this corner, please.

words: No. No, I didn't.

words: Well, that's okay. (Pointing) We'll make this next right, and swing around to get back to the dealership.

speaker: KRAMER
words: (Up to something) Well, it's a test drive, right? I never drive around here. If I'm gonna recommend this car, I need to see that it'll handle my daily

words: So where are we going?

speaker: KRAMER
words: Just a little place I like to call, "You'll see".

words: I'm starving. You got any of those free donuts you use to soften people up?

words: (Pointing out his office door) By the service department.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Getting up, he addresses Jerry) Alright, remember: no rust-proofing. Commit to nothing. If you have to speak - mumble.

words: (As George is leaving for the donuts) Au revoir, Le George.

words: Don't think it can't happen! (Leaves)

words: So, Puddy, this is a pretty good move for you, huh? No more "grease monkey".

words: I don't care for that term.

words: Oh. Sorry, I didn't know..

words: No, I don't know too many monkeys who could take apart a fuel injector.

words: I saw one once that could do sign language.

words: Yeah, I saw that one. Uh.. Koko.

speaker: JERRY
words: Yeah, Koko.

words: Right, Koko. That chimp's alright. (Holds up his hand) High-five.

words: Hey, hey, hey! What's goin' on here? (To Jerry) You didn't agree to anything, did ya?

words: No. We both just saw the same monkey.

words: (Aggravated) Well, I got screwed on the donuts. There were none left.

speaker: PUDDY
words: (Standing up) Well, there's a vending machine. I could show you where it is. (Leaves, showing George the way)

words: (To Jerry) Hey, gimme a dollar.

words: (Getting a dollar out) Where's your money?

words: (Talking it) I'm here helpin' you.

words: Hey. Where's Puddy? The copy machine is broken.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (On his way out) Heh, heh, heh. That's what they want you to think.

words: Hey, Elaine, have you noticed your boyfriend has developed an annoying little habit?

words: (Squints, imitating Puddy) The squinting?

speaker: JERRY
words: No.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Stares ahead, again, imitating Puddy) The staring?

speaker: JERRY
words: No. He keeps asking me to give him a high-five.

speaker: ELAINE
words: I thought all guys do that.

speaker: JERRY
words: Slapping hands is the lowest form of male primate ritual. In fact, even some of them have moved on - they're using sign language now.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Is that bad?

words: What do you think the Nazis were doin'? (Imitates the Nazi's salute) That was the heil-five.

speaker: ELAINE
words: (Pointing out) Isn't that from your act, like, ten years ago?

speaker: JERRY
words: (Slightly embarrassed) It was a good bit in the 80's, and it's still relatable today.

speaker: PUDDY
words: Good news. We got a 900 in black. That's the hot color. (Holds up his hand) High-five.

speaker: ELAINE
words: Um, David, you know what? Can you come help me fix the copy machine?

words: (Pointing at Jerry) You owe me five.

words: Twix.. (Makes various noises) B-5.

words: Ah, come on!

words: Ah, excuse me. Do you have change of a dollar?

words: (While retrieving his candy) No.

words: Could I, uh, could I trade you for another dollar?

speaker: MECHANIC
words: (While walking away) Don't have one.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Stopping him) Excuse me. When your, uh, when your wallet was open, I glanced inside, and I couldn't help but notice that you had several crisp dollar

words: (Calm) You're incorrect.

speaker: GEORGE
words: (Persistent) Perhaps you could look again, please? I'm very hungry.

speaker: MECHANIC
words: (While taking his exit) We had donuts earlier.

words: Mr. Kramer, we're really not allowed to use the cars to run errands.

words: No, look, Rick. I'm very close to giving this car, that my celebrity friend is considering, my full endorsement. (Looks out the window) Oooh, Let's see if

words: (Tapping the door you lift to retrieve your candy on the machine) I think the candy comes out over there.

words: People can drop change down here, Jerry. And they're too lazy to pick it up.

words: Either that, or they've got a little hang-up about lying face-down in filth. Why don't you just go to the cashier?

words: The cashier is at lunch - which is where I'd like to be.

words: How much was under there?

words: (Looking at his finger) I think somethin' bit me. I just need another nickel.

words: (While fishing through his pocket for change) Hey, Puddy thinks I should go for the CD player. What do you think? (Hands him a nickel)

words: They did?

words: (Holding his up) Last one.

words: Oh? Well, how much gas do you think is in there right now?

words: (Looking) Well, it's on "E".

words: (Pointing out) So, you want to know how far you can drive your friend's car for free.

words: (In the spotlight, his voice goes high) Well, I make it up to him in other ways.

words: Uh, it was dangling! There were only two left in the machine! He must've bought one, and gotten both.

words: Sir, are you gonna buy a car?

You know what these four people were? They were innocentbystanders. Now, you just think about that term. Innocent. Bystanders. Because that's exactly what they were. We know theywere bystanders, nobody's disputing that. So how can a bystander be guilty? No such thing. Have you ever heard of a guilty bystander? No, because you cannot be a bystander and be guilty.
